  9055                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
  9056                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
  9057                                  
  9058 0000038B B03C                    		mov	al, 60
  9059 0000038D F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
  9060 0000038F B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9061 00000391 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
  9062 00000393 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
  9063 00000396 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
  9064 00000398 F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
  9065 0000039A 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
  9066 0000039C B064                    		mov	al, 100
  9067 0000039E F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
  9068 000003A0 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
  9069 000003A2 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
  9070 000003A5 B700                    		mov	bh, 0
  9071 000003A7 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
  9072 000003A9 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9073                                  
  9074                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
  9075                                  
  9076 000003AC 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9077 000003AD 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
  9078 000003AE BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
  9079 000003B1 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
  9080 000003B3 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
  9081 000003B5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
  9082 000003B6 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
  9083 000003B8 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
  9084 000003BA 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9085 000003BD 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
  9086 000003BE BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
  9087 000003C1 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
  9088 000003C3 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  9089 000003C5 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9090 000003C7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
  9091 000003C9 98                      		cbw
  9092 000003CA 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
  9093 000003CB F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
  9094 000003CD 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
  9095 000003CF CB                      		retf			; far return
  9096                                  
  9097                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9098                                  
  9099                                  ; 17/10/2022
  9100                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9101                                  
  9102                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9103                                  ;
  9104                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
  9105                                  ;
  9106                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
  9107                                  ;
  9108                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
  9109                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
  9110                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
  9111                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
  9112                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
  9113                                  ;
  9114                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
  9115                                  ;
  9116                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9117                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9118                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9119                                  ;
  9120                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9121                                  
  9122                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
  9123 000003D0 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
  9124 000003D3 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
  9125                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
  9126 000003D4 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9127                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9128 000003D9 7426                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
  9129 000003DB 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
  9130                                  					; get binary hours
  9131                                  					; convert to bcd
  9132 000003DF FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9133                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
  9134 000003E3 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
  9135 000003E5 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
  9136 000003E9 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9137                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
  9138 000003ED 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
  9139 000003EF 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
  9140 000003F3 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9141                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd
  9142 000003F7 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
  9143 000003F9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
  9144 000003FB FA                      		cli
  9145 000003FC B403                    		mov	ah, 3
  9146 000003FE CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9147                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
  9148                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
  9149                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9150 00000400 FB                      		sti
  9151                                  no_cmos_1:				
  9152 00000401 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
  9153 00000405 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
  9154                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9155 00000409 FF1E[E206]              		call	far [ttticks]
  9156                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
  9157                                  					; convert time to ticks
  9158                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
  9159 0000040D FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
  9160 0000040E B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  9161 00000410 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  9162                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  9163                                  					; Return: time of day set
  9164                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
  9165 00000412 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt]
  9166 00000416 FB                      		sti
  9167                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9168 00000417 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9169 0000041C 740A                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
  9170 0000041E FF1E[0605]              		call	far [daycnttoday]
  9171                                  		;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
  9172                                  					; convert to bcd format
  9173 00000422 FA                      		cli
  9174 00000423 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
  9175 00000425 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9176                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
  9177                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  9178                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9179 00000427 FB                      		sti
  9180                                  no_cmos_2:
  9181                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9182                                  		; cf=0				
  9183                                  		;clc
  9184 00000428 C3                      		retn
  9185                                  
  9186                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9187                                  
  9188                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9189                                  
  9190                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9191                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9192                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9193                                  ;
  9194                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9195                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9196                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9197                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9198                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9199                                  ;
  9200                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9201                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9202                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9203                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9204                                  
  9205                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9206 00000429 E84E00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9207 0000042C 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9208                                  
  9209                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9210                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9211                                  ;
  9212                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9213                                  ;	       ----------------
  9214                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9215                                  ;
  9216                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9217                                  ;
  9218                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9219                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9220                                  ;		1,193,180
  9221                                  ;
  9222                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9223                                  ;
  9224                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9225                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9226                                  ;		59,659
  9227                                  ;
  9228                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9229                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9230                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9231                                  ;
  9232                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9233                                  ; multiply by 5
  9234                                  
  9235 00000430 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9236 00000432 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9237                                  					; multiply by 5
  9238 00000434 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9239 00000436 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9240 00000438 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9241 0000043A D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9242 0000043C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9243 0000043E 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9244 00000440 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9245                                  
  9246                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9247                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9248                                  
  9249 00000441 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9250 00000444 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9251                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9252 00000446 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9253 00000448 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9254 0000044A F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9255                                  
  9256                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9257                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9258                                  
  9259 0000044C 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9260 0000044E B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		;extract 1/100's
  9261                                  
  9262                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9263                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9264                                  
  9265 00000451 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9266 00000453 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9267 00000456 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9268 00000458 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9269                                  noadj:					
  9270 0000045B F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9271 0000045C 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9272                                  
  9273                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9274                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9275                                  
  9276 0000045E D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9277 00000460 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9278 00000462 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9279 00000464 B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9280 00000467 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9281 00000469 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9282 0000046B F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9283 0000046D 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9284                                  
  9285                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9286                                  
  9287 0000046F 50                      		push	ax
  9288 00000470 89F0                    		mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9289 00000472 AB                      		stosw
  9290 00000473 58                      		pop	ax
  9291 00000474 AB                      		stosw
  9292 00000475 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9293 00000477 AB                      		stosw
  9294 00000478 F8                      		clc
  9295 00000479 C3                      		retn
  9296                                  
  9297                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9298                                  
  9299                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9300                                  
  9301                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9302                                  ;
  9303                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9304                                  ;
  9305                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9306                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9307                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9308                                  ;
  9309                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9310                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9311                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9312                                  ;			else
  9313                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9314                                  ;		}
  9315                                  ;
  9316                                  ; USES : AX
  9317                                  ;
  9318                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9319                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9320                                  ;
  9321                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9322                                  
  9323                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9324                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9325 0000047A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9326 0000047C CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9327                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9328                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9329                                  					; midnight
  9330                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9331 0000047E 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9332 00000483 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9333 00000485 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9334                                  					; and not flag
  9335 00000487 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9336 0000048B C3                      		retn
  9337                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9338                                  
  9339                                  inc_case:				
  9340 0000048C 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9341 0000048E 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9342 00000490 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9343                                  no_rollover:				
  9344 00000494 C3                      		retn
  9345                                  
  9346                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9347                                  ; MSDISK.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
  9348                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9349                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9350                                  ; 09/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9351                                  
  9352                                  ; MSDISK.ASM - MSDOS 3.3 - 02/02/1988
  9353                                  ; 26/05/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  9354                                  ; 23/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
  9355

  9357

  9360                                  ;.SECALL:	resb 1

  9362                                  ;.FATNUM:	resb 1
  9363                                  ;.DIRNUM:	resw 1
  9364                                  ;.SECNUM:	resw 1
  9365                                  ;.FATID:	resb 1
  9366                                  ;.FATSIZE:	resw 1
  9367                                  ;.SLIM:		resw 1
  9368                                  ;.HLIM:		resw 1
  9369                                  ;.HIDDEN:	resw 1
  9370                                  ;.size:
  9371                                  ;endstruc
  9372                                  
  9373                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9374                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9375                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9376                                  
  9377                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9378                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9379                                  
  9380                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9381                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9382                                  
  9383                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9384                                  
  9385                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9386                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9387                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9388                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9389                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9390                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9391                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9392                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9393                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9394                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9395                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9396                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9397                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9398                                  
  9399                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9400                                  
  9401                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9402                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9403                                  ;
  9404                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9405                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9406                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9407                                  ;   else
  9408                                  ;	set slow = value
  9409                                  ;   ...
  9410                                  ;*********************************************
  9411                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9412                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9413                                  ;*	 use slow
  9414                                  ;*   else
  9415                                  ;*	 use fast
  9416                                  ;*********************************************
  9417                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9418                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9419                                  ;	use slow
  9420                                  ;   else
  9421                                  ;	use fast
  9422                                  ;   ...
  9423                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9424                                  ;
  9425                                  ;
  9426                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9427                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9428                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9429                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9430                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9431                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9432                                  
  9433                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9434                                  
  9435                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9436                                  
  9437                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)

  9441                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------

  9444

  9447

  9464                                  		dw 81Ah			; dsk_close

  9511                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================

  9513                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9514                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9515                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9516                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  9517                                  ;
  9518                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
  9519                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9520                                  
  9521                                  SetDrive:	
  9522                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
  9523 000004CB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
  9524                                  X_Scan_Loop:				
  9525 000004CF 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
  9526 000004D3 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
  9527 000004D5 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
  9528 000004D8 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
  9529 000004DB 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
  9530 000004DD F9                      		stc

  9536                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9537                                  
  9538                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9539                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9540                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9541                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9542                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
  9543                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9544                                  
  9545                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh

  9547 000004E2 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
  9548 000004E5 26F6452401              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
  9549                                  					; fchanged_by_format
  9550 000004EA 7416                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
  9551                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9552 000004EC 26806524FE              		and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format
  9553                                  		;and	word [es:di+23h], 0FEFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9554                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag
  9555 000004F1 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
  9556                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
  9557 000004F6 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9558                                  					; fnon_removable
  9559 000004FB 740C                    		jz	short wehaveafloppy
  9560 000004FD BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh	; Indicate media changed
  9561 00000500 EB2C                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
  9562                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9563                                  
  9564                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
  9565                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
  9566 00000502 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
  9567 00000507 7525                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9568                                  wehaveafloppy:				
  9569 00000509 31F6                    		xor	si, si		; Presume "I don't know"
  9570                                  
  9571                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
  9572                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
  9573                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
  9574                                  
  9575 0000050B 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?
  9576 00000510 740A                    		jz	short mChk_NoChangeLine	; Brif not
  9577 00000512 E87912                  		call	mediacheck	;  Call	into removable routine
  9578 00000515 7236                    		jb	short err_exitj
  9579 00000517 E8C913                  		call	haschange
  9580 0000051A 7512                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9581                                  mChk_NoChangeLine:

  9583                                  			
  9584 0000051C BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; Presume no change
  9585 0000051F A0[1E01]                		mov	al, [tim_drv]	; Last drive accessed
  9586 00000522 263A4504                		cmp	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
  9587                                  					; Is drive of last access the same?
  9588 00000526 7505                    		jnz	short Media_Unk	; No, then "i don't know"
  9589 00000528 E82800                  		call	Check_Time_Of_Access

  9603 00000537 07                      		pop	es
  9604 00000538 09F6                    		or	si, si
  9605 0000053A 790F                    		jns	short ret_carry_clear ;	volidok
  9606 0000053C 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
  9607 00000541 7403                    		jz	short mChk1_NoChangeLine ; Brif	no changeline support
  9608 00000543 E82F13                  		call	media_set_vid

  9617                                  err_exitj:

  9619                                  ret81:					
  9620 00000550 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; return error status
  9621 00000552 C3                      		retn			; return with carry set
  9622                                  
  9623                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9624                                  
  9625                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9626                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9627                                  ; drive.
  9628                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9629                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9630                                  ; returns in si:
  9631                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9632                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9633                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9634                                  ;
  9635                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9636                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9637                                  
  9638                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9639                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9640 00000553 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9641 00000556 E821FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9642 00000559 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9643                                  					; get stored time
  9644 0000055D 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9645 0000055F 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9646 00000563 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9647 00000565 751A                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9648 00000567 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9649 00000569 7511                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9650 0000056B FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9651 0000056F 803E[1D01]05            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9652                                  					; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9653 00000574 720C                    		jb	short timecheck_ret
  9654 00000576 FE0E[1D01]              		dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9655 0000057A EB05                    		jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9656                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9657                                  
  9658                                  timepassed:				
  9659 0000057C 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
  9660                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
  9661 0000057F 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
  9662                                  
  9663                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
  9664                                  timecheck_unk:				
  9665 00000581 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
  9666                                  timecheck_ret:				
  9667 00000582 C3                      		retn
  9668                                  
  9669                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

  9744                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------

  9781                                  		
  9782                                  		; 11/09/2023 (BugFix, DI is not start addr of BDS structure here)
  9783                                  		;;test	byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbig
  9784                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh)
  9785                                  		;test	byte [es:di+1Fh], 40h
  9786                                  
  9787                                  			; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
  9788                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
  9789                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
  9790                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
  9791                                  			; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
  9792                                  			; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!?
  9793                                  			;
  9794                                  			; Correct Code:
  9795                                  			; ;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig
  9796                                  			; 11/09/2023
  9797                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
  9798                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)

  9827                                  
  9828                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9829                                  
  9830                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9831                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9832                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9833                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9834                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9835                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9836                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9837                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9838                                  ;
  9839                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9840                                  ;
  9841                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9842                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9843                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9844                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9845                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9846                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9847                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9848                                  ;
  9849                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9850                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9851                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9852                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9853                                  
  9854                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.

 10019                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10020                                  
 10021                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10022                                  
 10023                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10024                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 10025                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 10026                                  ;
 10027                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 10028                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10029                                  
 10030                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10031                                  
 10032                                  readbootsec:	
 10033 000006B1 B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 10034 000006B3 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 10035 000006B6 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
 10036 000006B9 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 10037 000006BB 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 10038                                  
 10039                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 10040                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 10041                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 10042                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 10043                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 10044                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 10045                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 10046                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 10047                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 10048                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 10049                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 10050                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 10051                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 10052                                  		; informations
 10053                                  
 10054                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 10055                                  
 10056                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10057                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10058                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 10059                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 10060                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 10061                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 10062                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 10063                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10064                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10065                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10066                                  
 10067                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 10068 000006BD A0[4E01]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 10069 000006C0 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 10070 000006C2 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10071                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 10072 000006C4 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 10073 000006C6 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10074                                  					; no need for nop
 10075 000006C8 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 10076 000006CA 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10077 000006CC 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10078 000006D1 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10079                                  
 10080                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10081                                  ;
 10082                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 10083                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 10084                                  ;;
 10085                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 10086                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 10087                                  ;;
 10088                                  ;;check_signature:
 10089                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 10090                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 10091                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if single sided medium.
 10092                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 10093                                  
 10094                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 10095                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 10096                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 10097                                  
 10098                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10099                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
 10100 000006D3 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10101                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10102 000006D6 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10103 000006D7 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 10104 000006D9 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 10105 000006DB 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10106 000006DC 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10107                                  
 10108                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 10109                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 10110                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 10111                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 10112                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 10113                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 10114                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 10115                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 10116                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 10117                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 10118                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 10119                                  
 10120                                  checksinglesided:
 10121                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10122                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10123                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 10124 000006DE 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 10125 000006E0 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 10126 000006E2 A801                    		test	al, 1
 10127 000006E4 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 10128 000006E6 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 10129 000006EC 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 10130 000006EE 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 10131 000006F3 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 10132                                  
 10133                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 10134                                  
 10135                                  mustbeearlier:				
 10136 000006F5 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 10137                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10138 000006FA EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 10139                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10140                                  
 10141                                  invalidbootsec:				
 10142 000006FC 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 10143                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10144                                  movbpb_ret:
 10145                                  gooddsk:				
 10146 000006FD F8                      		clc
 10147                                  err_ret:
 10148 000006FE C3                      		retn
 10149                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10150                                  
 10151                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10152                                  ;err_ret:				
 10153                                  		;retn

 10155                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10156                                  
 10157                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10158                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10159                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10160                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10161                                  ;
 10162                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10163                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10164                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10165                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10166                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10167                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10168                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10169                                  
 10170                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10171                                  
 10172                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10173                                  movbpb:	
 10174 000006FF 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10175                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10176                                  					; sectors per unit
 10177 00000703 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10178                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10179                                  					; number of directory entries
 10180 00000707 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10181                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10182                                  					; size of drive
 10183 0000070B 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10184                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10185                                  					; media	descriptor
 10186 0000070F A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10187                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10188                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10189 00000712 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10190                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10191                                  					; sectors per track

 10193                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10194                                  					; number of heads

 10210                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10211                                  
 10212                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10213                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10214                                  ;by es:di.
 10215                                  
 10216                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10217                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 10218                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10219                                  ;      the boot record information.
 10220                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 10221                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10222                                  
 10223                                  		; 19/10/2022

 10231                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]

 10234                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 10235 0000074A 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10236 0000074E 57                      		push	di
 10237 0000074F 56                      		push	si

 10239 00000753 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 10240                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
 10241                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL

 10266                                  
 10267                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10268                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10269                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10270                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10271                                  ; output:
 10272                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10273                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10274                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10275                                  
 10276                                  readfat:	
 10277                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10278                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10279 0000076B 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10280 0000076D B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10281                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10282 00000770 E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10283 00000773 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10284 00000775 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10285                                  bad_fat_ret:				
 10286 00000777 C3                      		retn
 10287                                  
 10288                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10289                                  
 10290                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10291                                  
 10292                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10293                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10294                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10295                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10296                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10297                                  ;		dh has head
 10298                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10299                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10300                                  ;
 10301                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10302                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10303                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10304                                  ;
 10305                                  ;		carry set
 10306                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10307                                  ;
 10308                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10309                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10310                                  
 10311                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10312                                  
 10313                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10314                                  read_sector:	
 10315 00000778 55                      		push	bp
 10316 00000779 BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10317 0000077C 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10318 00000780 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10319                                  rd_ret:					
 10320 00000783 06                      		push	es
 10321 00000784 1E                      		push	ds
 10322 00000785 07                      		pop	es
 10323 00000786 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10324 00000789 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10325                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10326                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10327                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10328 0000078B 07                      		pop	es
 10329 0000078C 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10330                                  rd_rty:					
 10331 0000078E E87404                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10332 00000791 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10333 00000793 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10334                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10335                                  					; fnon_removable
 10336 00000798 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10337 0000079A 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10338 0000079F 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10339 000007A1 50                      		push	ax
 10340 000007A2 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10341 000007A3 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10342                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10343                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10344                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10345                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10346 000007A7 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10347 000007A9 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10348                                  		; 
 10349 000007AC 1F                      		pop	ds
 10350 000007AD A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10351 000007B0 58                      		pop	ax
 10352                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10353 000007B1 06                      		push	es
 10354 000007B2 1E                      		push	ds
 10355 000007B3 07                      		pop	es
 10356 000007B4 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10357 000007B7 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10358                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10359                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10360                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10361 000007B9 07                      		pop	es
 10362 000007BA 9C                      		pushf
 10363 000007BB 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10364 000007C0 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10365 000007C2 50                      		push	ax
 10366 000007C3 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10367 000007C6 1E                      		push	ds
 10368 000007C7 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10369 000007CB 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10370 000007CE 1F                      		pop	ds
 10371 000007CF 58                      		pop	ax
 10372                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10373 000007D0 9D                      		popf
 10374 000007D1 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10375 000007D3 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10376                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10377                                  
 10378                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10379 000007D5 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10380                                  					; return error
 10381 000007D7 F9                      		stc
 10382                                  
 10383                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10384                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10385                                  
 10386                                  okret2:					
 10387 000007D8 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10388 000007DC 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed
 10389 000007E0 26886D46                		mov	[es:di+46h], ch	; [es:di+BDS.track]
 10390                                  					; save last track accessed on this drive
 10391                                  					; preserve flags in case error occurred
 10392 000007E4 9C                      		pushf
 10393 000007E5 E8FD03                  		call	set_tim
 10394 000007E8 9D                      		popf			; restore flags
 10395 000007E9 5D                      		pop	bp
 10396 000007EA C3                      		retn
 10397

 10420 00000809 7404                    		jz	short exitjx	; watch	out for	wrap
 10421 0000080B 26FF4D20                		dec	word [es:di+20h]
 10422                                  exitjx:					
 10423                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10424                                  		; cf = 0
 10425                                  		;clc		; CF is	already	ZERO here (18/09/2022, MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10426                                  				; (19/07/2019 -	Erdogan	Tan - MSDOS 6.0	IO.SYS - retrodos4.s)
 10427 0000080F C3                      		retn

 10486                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10487                                  
 10488                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10489                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10490                                  
 10491                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10492                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10493                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10494                                  
 10495                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10496                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10497                                  ;
 10498                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 10499                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10500                                  
 10501                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10502                                  checksingle:		
 10503 0000083A 50                      		push	ax
 10504 0000083B 53                      		push	bx
 10505 0000083C 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10506                                  
 10507                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10508                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10509                                  
 10510 00000840 F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10511 00000843 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10512 00000845 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10513                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10514 00000848 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10515                                  
 10516                                  
 10517                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10518                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10519                                  
 10520 0000084A 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10521                                  					; get physical drive number
 10522 0000084E 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10523 0000084F 57                      		push	di
 10524 00000850 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10525                                  scan_list:				
 10526 00000854 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10527 00000858 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10528 0000085A B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10529 0000085C 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10530 00000860 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10531 00000862 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10532 00000866 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10533 00000867 07                      		pop	es
 10534 00000868 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10535                                  
 10536                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10537                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10538                                  ; in this case.
 10539 0000086C 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10540 00000871 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10541                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 10542 00000873 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10543 00000878 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 10544 0000087A 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 10545                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 10546                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 10547 0000087E 06                      		push	es
 10548 0000087F 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10549 00000883 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 10550                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10551                                  					; set up sdsb
 10552 00000887 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 10553 00000888 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10554                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10555                                  
 10556                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10557                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10558                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10559                                  
 10560                                  not_fsetowner:				
 10561 0000088A 803E[7800]02            		cmp	byte [single], 2 ; if (single_drive_system)
 10562 0000088F 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 10563 00000891 50                      		push	ax
 10564 00000892 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10565 00000896 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 10566 00000898 06                      		push	es
 10567 00000899 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10568 0000089D 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 10569                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10570                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10571 000008A2 07                      		pop	es
 10572 000008A3 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 10573 000008A5 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10574 000008A6 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 10575                                  ignore_sdsb:				
 10576 000008A8 E85C0E                  		call	swpdsk
 10577 000008AB EB0B                    		jmp	short singleret
 10578                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10579                                  
 10580                                  scan_skip:	
 10581 000008AD 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]			
 10582                                  		;les	di, es:[di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 10583                                  					; go to	next bds
 10584 000008B0 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 10585 000008B3 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 10586 000008B5 F9                      		stc
 10587 000008B6 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 10588 000008B7 07                      		pop	es
 10589                                  
 10590                                  singleret:				
 10591 000008B8 5B                      		pop	bx
 10592 000008B9 58                      		pop	ax
 10593 000008BA C3                      		retn
 10594                                  
 10595                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10596

 10599 000008BD EB02                    		jmp	short baddrive_ret

 10601

 10611                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10612                                  
 10613                                  ; 15/10/52022
 10614                                  
 10615                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10616                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10617                                  ;
 10618                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10619                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10620                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10621                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10622                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10623                                  ;	ds = cs
 10624                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10625                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10626                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10627                                  ;
 10628                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10629                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 10630                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10631                                  
 10632                                  diskrd:	
 10633                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 10634                                  		; 19/10/2022
