 13011                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13012                                  ; Ioctl_Support_Query
 13013                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13014                                  ;
 13015                                  ; New device command which was added in DOS 5.00 to allow a query of a 
 13016                                  ; specific GENERIC IOCtl to see if it is supported. Bit 7 in the
 13017                                  ; device attributes specifies if this function is supported.
 13018                                  ;
 13019                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13020                                  
 13021                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13022                                  ioctl_support_query:
 13023 00001244 06                      		push	es
 13024 00001245 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX Points to request header.
 13025 00001249 268B470D                		mov	ax, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
 13026                                  					; AL ==	Major, AH == Minor
 13027 0000124D 3C08                    		cmp	al, 8		; IOC_DC
 13028                                  					; See if major code is 8
 13029 0000124F 7513                    		jnz	short nosupport
 13030 00001251 0E                      		push	cs
 13031 00001252 07                      		pop	es
 13032 00001253 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 13033                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13034 00001256 BF[370C]                		mov	di, IOC_DC_Table
 13035                                  		;mov	di, 0C60h	; IOC_DC_Table
 13036                                  					; at 2C7h:0C60h	= 70h:31D0h
 13037 00001259 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah		; Put minor code in AL
 13038 0000125B F2AE                    		repne scasb		; Scan for minor code in AL
 13039 0000125D 7505                    		jnz	short nosupport	; it was not found
 13040 0000125F B80001                  		mov	ax, 100h
 13041                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13042                                  		; (jump to ioctlsupexit is not required)
 13043                                  		;jmp	short $+2	; ioctlsupexit
 13044                                  					; Signal ioctl is supported
 13045                                  		;;jmp	short ioctlsupexit
 13046                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13047                                  ioctlsupexit:				
 13048 00001262 07                      		pop	es
 13049                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13050                                  		; cf = 0
 13051                                  		;clc
 13052 00001263 C3                      		retn
 13053                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13054                                  nosupport:				
 13055 00001264 07                      		pop	es
 13056 00001265 E96DEE                  		jmp	bc_cmderr
 13057                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13058                                  
 13059                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13060                                  
 13061                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13062                                  ;	GetMediaSenseStatus
 13063                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13064                                  ;
 13065                                  ; FUNCTION: Will return the type of diskette media in the specified DOS
 13066                                  ;	    diskette drive and whether the media is the default type
 13067                                  ;	    for that drive. (default type means the max size for that
 13068                                  ;	    drive)
 13069                                  ;
 13070                                  ; INPUT :   ES:DI -> BDS table
 13071                                  ; OUTPUT:   If carry clear
 13072                                  ;	    DS:BX -> Updated IOCtlPacket
 13073                                  ;
 13074                                  ;			 Special Function at offset 0:
 13075                                  ;				0	- Media detected is not default type
 13076                                  ;				1	- Media detected is default type
 13077                                  ;
 13078                                  ;			 Device Type at offset 1:
 13079                                  ;				2       - 720K 3.5" 80 tracks
 13080                                  ;				7	- 1.44M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13081                                  ;				9	- 2.88M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13082                                  ;
 13083                                  ; Error Codes returned in AX if carry set:
 13084                                  ;
 13085                                  ; 8102 - Drive not ready	- No disk is in the drive.
 13086                                  ; 8107 - Unknown media type	- Drive doesn't support this function or
 13087                                  ;				  the media is really unkown, any error
 13088                                  ;				  other than "media not present"
 13089                                  ; 
 13090                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13091                                  
 13092                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13093                                  SenseMediaType:				
 13094 00001268 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header.
 13095 0000126C C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13096                                  		; 10/10/2022
 13097                                  		;mov	word [bx], 0	; Initialize the 2 packet bytes
 13098 0000126F 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13099 00001271 8917                    		mov	[bx], dx ; 0
 13100                                  		;
 13101 00001273 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13102                                  					; Get int 13h drive number from	BDS
 13103                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13104                                  		;xor	dh, dh		; DX = physical	drive number
 13105 00001277 B420                    		mov	ah, 20h		; Get Media Type function
 13106                                  					; If no	carry media type in AL
 13107 00001279 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - QCACHE	- DISMOUNT
 13108 0000127B 7216                    		jb	short MediaSenseEr ; error code	in AH
 13109 0000127D FE07                    		inc	byte [bx]	; Signal media type is default (bit 1)
 13110                                  DetermineMediaType:			
 13111 0000127F FEC8                    		dec	al
 13112 00001281 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; Chk for 720K ie: (3-1) = 2
 13113 00001283 740A                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13114 00001285 0404                    		add	al, 4
 13115 00001287 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7		; Chk for 1.44M ie: (4-1+4) = 7
 13116 00001289 7404                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13117 0000128B 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9		; Chk for 2.88M	ie: (6-1+4) = 9
 13118 0000128D 7510                    		jnz	short UnknownMediaType ; Just didn't recognize media type
 13119                                  GotMediaType:				
 13120 0000128F 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; Save the return value
 13121                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13122                                  		; cf = 0
 13123                                  		;clc			; Signal success
 13124 00001292 C3                      		retn
 13125                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13126                                  
 13127                                  MediaSenseEr:				
 13128 00001293 80FC32                  		cmp	ah, 32h		; See if not default media error
 13129 00001296 74E7                    		jz	short DetermineMediaType ; Not really an error
 13130 00001298 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; Now assume drive not ready
 13131 0000129A 80FC31                  		cmp	ah, 31h		; See if media was present
 13132 0000129D 7402                    		jz	short SenseErrExit ; Return drive not ready
 13133                                  UnknownMediaType:			
 13134 0000129F B007                    		mov	al, 7		; Just don't know the media type
 13135                                  SenseErrExit:				
 13136 000012A1 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Signal error return
 13137 000012A3 F9                      		stc
 13138 000012A4 C3                      		retn
 13139                                  
 13140                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13141                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13142                                  		;db    0
 13143                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13144                                  
 13145                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13146                                  
 13147                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13148                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 13149                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13150                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13151                                  
 13152                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 13153                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 13154                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 13155                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 13156                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 13157                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 13158                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 13159                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 13160                                  ;
 13161                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 13162                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 13163                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 13164                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 13165                                  ;
 13166                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 13167                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 13168                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 13169                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 13170                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 13171                                  ;
 13172                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 13173                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 13174                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 13175                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 13176                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 13177                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 13178                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 13179                                  
 13180                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 13181                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 13182                                  
 13183                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 13184                                  
 13185                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 13186 000012A5 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 13187 000012A8 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 13188 000012AA 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 13189 000012AD 7431                    		jz	short mine
 13190                                  
 13191                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 13192                                  
 13193 000012AF 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 13194 000012B2 746C                    		jz	short win386call
 13195 000012B4 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT
 13196 000012B7 7503                    		jnz	short i2f_handler_iret
 13197 000012B9 E99700                  		jmp	handle_multmult
 13198                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13199                                  
 13200                                  i2f_handler_iret:			
 13201 000012BC CF                      		iret
 13202                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13203                                  
 13204                                  int2f_replace_int13:			
 13205 000012BD 50                      		push	ax	; free up a register for caller's ds
 13206 000012BE 8CD8                    		mov	ax, ds	; then we can use ds: -> Bios_Data
 13207                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h] ; 15/10/2022	
 13208                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13209                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13210 000012C0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
 13211                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13212                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13	; save old value of old13 and
 13213                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13+2	; orig13 so that we can
 13214                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13	; return them to caller
 13215                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13+2
 13216                                  		
 13217                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13218                                  		;push	word [Orig13]
 13219 000012C5 FF36[B600]              		push	word [Orig13+2]
 13220                                  		;push	word [Old13]
 13221 000012C9 FF36[0801]              		push	word [Old13+2]
 13222                                  
 13223                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13, dx	; orig13 := addr. of new int_13
 13224                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13+2, ax
 13225                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13, bx	; old13 := addr. of new boot_13
 13226                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13+2, es
 13227                                  		
 13228                                  		;mov	[Orig13], dx
 13229                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13230 000012CD 8716[B400]              		xchg	dx, [Orig13]
 13231 000012D1 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
 13232                                  		;mov	[Old13], bx
 13233                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13234 000012D4 871E[0601]              		xchg	bx, [Old13]
 13235 000012D8 8C06[0801]              		mov	[Old13+2], es
 13236                                  
 13237 000012DC 07                      		pop	es			; es:bx := old old13 vector
 13238                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13239                                  		;pop	bx
 13240 000012DD 1F                      		pop	ds			; ds:dx := old orig13 vector
 13241                                  		;pop	dx ; 02/09/2023
 13242 000012DE 58                      		pop	ax
 13243                                  i2f_iret:
 13244 000012DF CF                      		iret
 13245                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13246                                  
 13247                                  mine:					
 13248 000012E0 3CF8                    		cmp	al, 0F8h 		; iret on reserved functions
 13249 000012E2 73FB                    		jnb	short i2f_iret
 13250 000012E4 08C0                    		or	al, al			; a get installed state request?
 13251 000012E6 7503                    		jnz	short disp_func
 13252 000012E8 B0FF                    		mov	al, 0FFh
 13253                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13254                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13255 000012EA CF                      		iret
 13256                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13257                                  
 13258                                  disp_func:				
 13259 000012EB 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1			; request for installing bds?
 13260 000012ED 7418                    		jz	short do_subfun_01
 13261 000012EF 3C03                    		cmp	al, 3			; get bds vector?
 13262 000012F1 7423                    		jz	short do_get_bds_vector
 13263                                  
 13264                                  ; set up pointer to request packet
 13265                                  
 13266 000012F3 1E                      		push	ds
 13267 000012F4 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022	
 13268                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13269                                  					; = [0070h:25A0h] = [02C7h:0030h]
 13270                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13271                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav, bx
 13272                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav+2, es

 13321                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.

 13443                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13444                                  ;
 13445                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13446                                  ;
 13447                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13448                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13449                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13450                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13451                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13452                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13453                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13454                                  ;
 13455                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13456                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13457                                  ;
 13458                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13459                                  
 13460                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13461                                  HMAPtr:
 13462 000013A0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13463                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13464 000013A5 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13465                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13466 000013A9 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13467 000013AC 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13468 000013AE 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13469                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13470 000013B3 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13471 000013B5 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13472                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13473 000013B9 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13474                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13475                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13476 000013BD C3                      		retn
 13477                                  
 13478                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13479                                  
 13480                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13481                                  
 13482                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13483                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13484                                  
 13485                                  move_sector:
 13486                                  
 13487                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13488                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13489                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13490                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13491                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13492                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13493                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13494                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13495                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13496                                  ;
 13497                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13498                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13499                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13500                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13501                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13502                                  
 13503 000013BE FC                      		cld
 13504 000013BF 51                      		push	cx
 13505 000013C0 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13506 000013C3 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13507 000013C7 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13508 000013C9 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13509 000013CD 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13510 000013CF F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13511 000013D1 59                      		pop	cx
 13512 000013D2 C3                      		retn
 13513                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13514                                  
 13515                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13516 000013D3 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13517 000013D5 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13518 000013D7 59                      		pop	cx
 13519 000013D8 C3                      		retn
 13520                                  
 13521                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13522                                  
 13523                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13524                                  
 13525                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13526                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13527                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13528                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13529                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13530                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13531                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13532                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13533                                  ;
 13534                                  ; input conditions:
 13535                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13536                                  ;
 13537                                  ; output:
 13538                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13539                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13540                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13541                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13542                                  
 13543                                  check_wrap:	
 13544 000013D9 50                      		push	ax
 13545 000013DA 53                      		push	bx
 13546 000013DB 06                      		push	es
 13547 000013DC 57                      		push	di
 13548 000013DD E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13549 000013E0 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13550                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13551 000013E2 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13552                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13553 000013E7 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13554 000013E9 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13555 000013ED 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13556 000013EF 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13557 000013F2 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13558 000013F4 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13559 000013F6 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13560                                  
 13561                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13562                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13563                                  
 13564 000013F8 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13565 000013FA 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13566                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13567 000013FC 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13568 000013FD 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13569                                  					; if on	boundary
 13570                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13571                                  not_on_bound:				
 13572 000013FF 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13573 00001402 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13574 00001404 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13575 00001406 40                      		inc	ax
 13576 00001407 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13577 00001409 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13578                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13579 0000140C 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13580 00001410 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 13581                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13582                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13583 00001412 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13584 00001414 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13585 00001415 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13586                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13587 00001417 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13588                                  
 13589                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13590                                  
 13591 00001419 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13592 0000141B 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13593 0000141D 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13594                                  
 13595                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13596                                  
 13597 0000141F 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13598 00001421 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13599 00001423 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13600                                  no_head_bound:				
 13601 00001424 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13602 00001426 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13603 00001427 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13604 00001429 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13605 0000142B 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13606 0000142D 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13607 00001430 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13608 00001432 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13609 00001434 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13610 00001436 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13611 00001438 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13612 0000143A D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13613 0000143C 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13614 0000143E 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13615                                  no_wrap:				
 13616 00001440 F8                      		clc
 13617 00001441 5F                      		pop	di
 13618 00001442 07                      		pop	es
 13619 00001443 5B                      		pop	bx
 13620 00001444 58                      		pop	ax
 13621 00001445 C3                      		retn
 13622                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13623                                  
 13624                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13625 00001446 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13626 00001448 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13627 0000144A EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13628                                  
 13629                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13630                                  
 13631                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13632                                  
 13633                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13634                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13635                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13636                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13637                                  ;
 13638                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13639                                  
 13640                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13641                                  find_bds:	
 13642 0000144C C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13643                                  fbds_1:					
 13644 00001450 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13645 00001454 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13646 00001456 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13647                                  					; go to next bds
 13648 00001459 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13649 0000145C 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13650 0000145E F9                      		stc
 13651                                  fdbs_2:					
 13652 0000145F C3                      		retn
 13653                                  
 13654                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13655                                  
 13656                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13657                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13658                                  doint:
 13659                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13660 00001460 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13661                                  					; get physical drive number
 13662                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13663                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13664                                  		
 13665 00001463 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13666 00001465 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13667 00001467 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13668                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13669 00001469 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13670                                  					; get request code
 13671                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13672 0000146C FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13673                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13674 0000146F 9D                      		popf
 13675                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13676                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13677 00001470 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13678                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13679                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13680 00001475 9C                      		pushf
 13681                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13682 00001476 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13683                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13684                                  dointdone:				
 13685 00001479 C3                      		retn
 13686                                  
 13687                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13688                                  
 13689                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13690                                  
 13691                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13692                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13693                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13694                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13695                                  ;
 13696                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13697                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13698                                  ;
 13699                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13700                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13701                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13702                                  
 13703                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13704                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13705                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13706                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13707                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13708                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13709                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13710                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13711                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13712                                  ;end struc
 13713                                  
 13714                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13715                                  
 13716                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13717                                  ;	ah = function
 13718                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13719                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13720                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13721                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13722                                  ;   output conditions:
 13723                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13724                                  
 13725                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13726                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13727                                  ;
 13728                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13729                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13730                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13731                                  
 13732                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13733                                  
 13734                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13735                                  
 13736 0000147A 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13737                                  
 13738                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13739                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13740                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13741                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13742                                  
 13743                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13744                                  
 13745                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13746                                  
 13747                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13748                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13749                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive

 13751                                  format_special_stuff:

 13756 00001489 E83004                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13757 0000148C 5B                      		pop	bx
 13758 0000148D EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done

 13760                                  
 13761                                  ; 16/10/2022

 13763                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13764                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13765                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h

 13772 00001494 51                      		push	cx

 13776 0000149B 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13777 0000149F 59                      		pop	cx
 13778 000014A0 58                      		pop	ax

 13780                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13781 000014A3 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13782 000014A4 06                      		push	es
 13783                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13784 000014A5 2EC41E[7A14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13785                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13786                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h

 13788 000014AC 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13789 000014AF 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13790                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13791                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13792 000014B3 07                      		pop	es
 13793 000014B4 5B                      		pop	bx
 13794 000014B5 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done

 13796                                  
 13797                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13798                                  
 13799                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13800                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13801                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13802                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13803                                  
 13804                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13805 000014B7 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13806                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13807 000014BC 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13808 000014BE 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13809                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13810 000014C3 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13811                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13812 000014C5 50                      		push	ax
 13813 000014C6 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13814                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13815                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13816 000014C8 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13817                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13818                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13819 000014CD 58                      		pop	ax
 13820 000014CE EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13821                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13822                                  
 13823                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13824                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13825                                  
 13826                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13827                                  
 13828                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13829                                  
 13830                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13831                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13832                                  
 13833                                  		; 19/10/2022

 13835                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13836                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data

 13838                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13839                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13840                                  
 13841                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13842                                  
 13843 000014D6 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13844 000014D9 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13845 000014DC 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13846                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13847                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13848 000014DE 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13849 000014E3 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13850                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13851                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13852                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13853 000014E5 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13854                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13855                                  		
 13856 000014EA 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13857                                  		
 13858 000014EB 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13859                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13860 000014F0 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13861                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13862                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13863 000014F2 9D                      		popf
 13864 000014F3 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13865                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13866 000014F5 1F                      		pop	ds
 13867 000014F6 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13868                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13869                                  
 13870                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13871                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13872                                  ; a changeline error.
 13873                                  
 13874                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13875 000014F9 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13876                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13877 000014FB 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13878 000014FE 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13879 00001500 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13880 00001502 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13881 00001504 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13882 00001509 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13883                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13884                                  					; never	would

 13887 0000150F E8AA03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13888 00001512 5B                      		pop	bx
 13889                                  int13b:

 13891 00001514 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13892                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13893                                  
 13894                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13895                                  
 13896                                  goterr13:

 13899                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13900 0000151B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13901 0000151E 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13902 00001520 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13903 00001525 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13904                                  
 13905 00001527 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13906                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13907                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13908                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13909 0000152C 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13910                                  
 13911 0000152E 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13912                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13913                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13914 00001530 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13915                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13916                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13917 00001535 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13918 00001538 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13919 0000153A 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13920 0000153C 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13921 0000153E 53                      		push	bx
 13922 0000153F 51                      		push	cx
 13923 00001540 52                      		push	dx
 13924 00001541 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13925                                  loop_ecc:				
 13926 00001544 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13927                                  
 13928                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13929                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13930                                  ;
 13931                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13932                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13933                                  ; track.
 13934                                  ;
 13935                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13936                                  ; this request.
 13937                                  ;
 13938                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13939                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13940                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13941                                  ;
 13942 00001547 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13943                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13944                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13945 0000154A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13946                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13947 0000154F 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13948 00001551 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13949 00001554 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13950 00001556 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13951 00001559 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13952                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13953                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13954                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13955 0000155B 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13956                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13957                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13958                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13959                                  ok11_op:				
 13960 0000155D FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13961 00001561 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13962 00001563 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13963                                  					; add 200h to address
 13964 00001565 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13965 00001567 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13966 00001569 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13967                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13968                                  
 13969                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13970                                  
 13971                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13972 0000156B F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13973                                  ok11_exit:				
 13974 0000156C 5A                      		pop	dx
 13975 0000156D 59                      		pop	cx
 13976 0000156E 5B                      		pop	bx
 13977 0000156F EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13978                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13979                                  
 13980                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13981                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13982                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13983                                  
 13984                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13985 00001571 06                      		push	es
 13986 00001572 53                      		push	bx
 13987 00001573 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13988 00001576 1E                      		push	ds
 13989 00001577 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13990 00001578 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13991                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13992                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13993 0000157B 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13994                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13995 00001580 5B                      		pop	bx
 13996 00001581 07                      		pop	es
 13997 00001582 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13998 00001584 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13999 00001587 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14000                                  
 14001                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14002                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14003                                  
 14004                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 14005 00001589 56                      		push	si
 14006 0000158A 57                      		push	di
 14007 0000158B 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14008 0000158D BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14009 00001590 E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14010 00001593 5F                      		pop	di
 14011 00001594 5E                      		pop	si
 14012 00001595 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14013                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14014                                  
 14015                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14016                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14017                                  
 14018                                  gotdmaerr:				
 14019 00001597 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14020 0000159A FB                      		sti
 14021 0000159B 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14022 0000159E 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14023                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14024                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14025 000015A0 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14026 000015A3 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14027 000015A5 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14028 000015A8 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14029 000015AA 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14030                                  
 14031                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14032                                  
 14033                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14034                                  
 14035 000015AC 52                      		push	dx
 14036 000015AD 51                      		push	cx
 14037 000015AE 53                      		push	bx
 14038 000015AF 50                      		push	ax
 14039 000015B0 55                      		push	bp
 14040 000015B1 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14041 000015B3 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14042 000015B5 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14043 000015B7 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14044 000015B9 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14045 000015BB D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14046 000015BD 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14047 000015BF 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14048                                  
 14049                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14050                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14051                                  
 14052 000015C3 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14053 000015C5 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14054                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14055                                  
 14056                                  no_skip_first:				
 14057 000015C8 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14058 000015CA B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14059 000015CC 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14060                                  
 14061                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14062                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14063                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14064                                  ;
 14065                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14066                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14067                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14068                                  ; in error.
 14069                                  
 14070 000015CE 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14071 000015D0 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14072                                  
 14073                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14074                                  
 14075 000015D2 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14076                                  					; set up head number
 14077 000015D5 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14078 000015D8 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14079                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14080                                  
 14081                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 14082 000015DB B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14083 000015DD F9                      		stc
 14084 000015DE E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14085                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14086                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14087                                  
 14088                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14089                                  
 14090                                  intverify:				
 14091 000015E1 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14092 000015E2 53                      		push	bx
 14093 000015E3 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14094 000015E4 07                      		pop	es
 14095                                  dosimple:				
 14096 000015E5 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14097                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14098                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14099                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14100 000015E8 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14101                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14102 000015ED 5B                      		pop	bx
 14103 000015EE 07                      		pop	es
 14104 000015EF E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14105                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14106                                  
 14107                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14108                                  
 14109                                  intformat:				
 14110 000015F2 06                      		push	es
 14111 000015F3 53                      		push	bx
 14112 000015F4 56                      		push	si
 14113 000015F5 57                      		push	di
 14114 000015F6 1E                      		push	ds
 14115                                  
 14116                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14117                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14118                                  
 14119 000015F7 06                      		push	es
 14120 000015F8 1E                      		push	ds
 14121 000015F9 07                      		pop	es
 14122 000015FA 1F                      		pop	ds
 14123 000015FB 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14124 000015FD BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14125 00001600 E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14126 00001603 1F                      		pop	ds
 14127 00001604 5F                      		pop	di
 14128 00001605 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14129 00001606 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14130                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14131                                  
 14132                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14133                                  ; the first block.
 14134                                  ;
 14135                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14136                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14137                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14138                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14139                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14140                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14141                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14142                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14143                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14144                                  
 14145                                  doblock:
 14146                                  
 14147                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14148                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14149                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14150                                  				
 14151 00001608 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14152                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14153 0000160B 51                      		push	cx
 14154 0000160C 06                      		push	es
 14155 0000160D 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14156                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14157 0000160E E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14158 00001611 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14159                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14160 00001615 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14161                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14162 0000161A 5F                      		pop	di
 14163 0000161B 07                      		pop	es
 14164 0000161C 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14165 0000161E 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14166 00001620 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14167 00001622 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14168                                  doblockflop:				
 14169 00001624 59                      		pop	cx
 14170                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14171 00001625 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14172 00001627 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14173 00001629 50                      		push	ax
 14174 0000162A 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14175 0000162C EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14176                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14177                                  
 14178                                  doblocklast:				
 14179 0000162E 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14180 00001630 50                      		push	ax
 14181                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14182 00001631 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14183 00001634 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14184 00001636 58                      		pop	ax
 14185 00001637 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14186                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14187 0000163A 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14188 0000163C 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14189 0000163E 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14190 00001640 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14191 00001642 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14192                                  					; then we are done already.
 14193 00001644 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14194                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14195 00001646 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14196 00001649 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14197                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14198                                  
 14199                                  bufferx:				
 14200 0000164B 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14201                                  					; set up head number
 14202                                  buffer:					
 14203 0000164E 53                      		push	bx
 14204 0000164F 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14205 00001652 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14206 00001655 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14207                                  					
 14208                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14209                                  
 14210 00001657 06                      		push	es
 14211 00001658 1E                      		push	ds
 14212 00001659 56                      		push	si
 14213 0000165A 57                      		push	di
 14214 0000165B 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14215 0000165C 06                      		push	es
 14216 0000165D 1F                      		pop	ds
 14217 0000165E 07                      		pop	es
 14218 0000165F BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14219 00001662 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14220 00001663 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14221 00001665 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14222 00001668 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14223                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14224 00001669 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14225 0000166A 5E                      		pop	si
 14226 0000166B 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14227                                  
 14228                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14229                                  
 14230 0000166C B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14231                                  					; get drive number
 14232 0000166E 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14233 00001671 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14234                                  					;
 14235                                  					; ah is	function
 14236                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14237                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14238                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14239                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14240                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14241 00001674 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14242 00001677 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14243 00001678 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14244 0000167A EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14245                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14246                                  
 14247                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14248                                  
 14249                                  doread:					
 14250 0000167C 06                      		push	es
 14251 0000167D 53                      		push	bx
 14252 0000167E 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14253 0000167F 07                      		pop	es
 14254 00001680 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14255 00001683 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14256 00001685 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14257                                  					; get drive number
 14258 00001688 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14259                                  					; ah = function
 14260                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14261                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14262                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14263 0000168B E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14264 0000168E 5B                      		pop	bx
 14265 0000168F 07                      		pop	es
 14266 00001690 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14267 00001692 56                      		push	si
 14268 00001693 57                      		push	di
 14269 00001694 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14270 00001696 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14271 00001699 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14272 0000169C 5F                      		pop	di
 14273 0000169D 5E                      		pop	si
 14274                                  
 14275                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14276                                  
 14277                                  dotail:					
 14278 0000169E 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14279 0000169F 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14280 000016A2 41                      		inc	cx
 14281 000016A3 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14282 000016A6 F8                      		clc
 14283 000016A7 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14284 000016A9 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14285                                  
 14286                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14287                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14288                                  
 14289 000016AB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14290 000016AE E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14291 000016B1 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14292                                  
 14293                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14294                                  
 14295                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14296                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14297                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14298                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14299                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14300                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14301                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14302                                  
 14303                                  bad13:					
 14304 000016B4 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14305 000016B6 5D                      		pop	bp
 14306 000016B7 5B                      		pop	bx
 14307 000016B8 5B                      		pop	bx
 14308 000016B9 59                      		pop	cx
 14309 000016BA 5A                      		pop	dx
 14310 000016BB 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14311 000016BD E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14312                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14313                                  
 14314                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14315 000016C0 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14316                                  
 14317                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14318                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14319                                  		;db 	0
 14320                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14321                                  
 14322                                  ;Bios_Code ends
