 19156                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19157                                  ;
 19158                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 19159                                  ;
 19160                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 19161                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 19162                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 19163                                  ;
 19164                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 19165                                  ;
 19166                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19167                                  
 19168                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19169                                  MovDOSHi:
 19170                                  	; 14/05/2019
 19171                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19172                                  	; ds = cs
 19173 000008E9 E8D500                  	call	AllocHMA
 19174 000008EC 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; did we get HMA?
 19175 000008EE B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh
 19176 000008F1 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19177                                  
 19178                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 19179                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 19180                                  
 19181                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 19182                                  	; 24/03/2019
 19183                                  	
 19184                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19185 000008F3 E83200                  	call	MovBIOS				; First move BIOS into HMA
 19186                                  
 19187                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 19188                                  	
 19189                                  	; 14/05/2019
 19190                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19191                                  	;xor	di,di
 19192                                  	
 19193                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19194                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 19195                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19196                                  	; ds = cs
 19197 000008F6 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 19198 000008FA E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 19199                                  
 19200                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 19201                                  ;else
 19202                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 19203                                  ;
 19204                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0
 19205                                  ;
 19206                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 19207                                  
 19208 000008FD E85D02                  	call	SaveFreeHMAPtr			; Save the Free HMA ptr
 19209 00000900 F8                      	clc
 19210                                  mdhx:
 19211 00000901 C3                      	retn

 19539                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19540                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19541                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19542                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19543                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19544                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19545                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19546                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19547                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19548                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19549                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19550                                  ;
 19551                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19552                                  
 19553                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19554                                  update_arena:
 19555 0000097A 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19556 0000097B 57                      	push	di
 19557 0000097C 51                      	push	cx
 19558 0000097D 52                      	push	dx
 19559                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19560                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19561                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19562                                  	; ds = cs 
 19563 0000097E C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19564 00000982 4F                      	dec	di
 19565 00000983 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19566                                  						;  before sysvar
 19567 00000984 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19568                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19569 00000986 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19570 0000098B 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19571 0000098D 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19572                                  
 19573                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19574 0000098F 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19575 00000994 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19576 00000996 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19577 00000998 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19578 0000099A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19579                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19580 0000099C 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19581                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19582 000009A0 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19583 000009A6 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19584                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19585 000009A8 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19586 000009AC 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19587                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19588                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19589 000009AE 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19590 000009B1 5A                      	pop	dx
 19591 000009B2 59                      	pop	cx
 19592 000009B3 5F                      	pop	di
 19593 000009B4 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19594 000009B5 C3                      	retn

 19596                                  ; M012 : END

 19616                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19617                                  ;
 19618                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19619                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19620                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19621                                  ;
 19622                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19623                                  ;
 19624                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19625                                  
 19626                                  AllocHMA:
 19627                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19628                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19629                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19630                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19631                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19632                                  
 19633                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19634                                  ;
 19635                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19636                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19637                                  ;	push	ax
 19638                                  ;	popf
 19639                                  ;	pushf
 19640                                  ;	pop	ax
 19641                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)

 19645                                  
 19646                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19647                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)

 19662                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 19663

 19693

 19784                                  
 19785                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19786                                  ;
 19787                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19788                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19789                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19790                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19791                                  ;
 19792                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19793                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19794                                  ;
 19795                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19796                                  
 19797                                  StartVDHead:
 19798                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19799                                  
 19800 00000A39 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19801 00000A3D 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19802 00000A3F 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19803 00000A41 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19804 00000A43 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19805                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19806 00000A44 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19807                                  VDiskSig1:
 19808 00000A4B 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19809                                  
 19810                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19811                                  
 19812 00000A50 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19813                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19814 00000A56 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19815 00000A65 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19816 00000A67 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19817                                  VDInt19:
 19818 00000A68 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19819                                  OldVDInt19:
 19820 00000A69 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19821                                  
 19822                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19823                                  
 19824                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19825 00000A6D 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19826                                  VDiskSig2:
 19827 00000A70 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19828                                  
 19829                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19830                                  
 19831 00000A75 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19832 00000A78 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19833 00000A7A 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19834 00000A7B 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19835 00000A7D 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19836 00000A7E 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19837 00000A80 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19838 00000A82 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19839 00000A83 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19840 00000A85 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19841 00000A87 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19842 00000A89 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19843 00000A8B 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19844                                  
 19845                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 19846                                  
 19847                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19848                                  ;
 19849                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19850                                  ;
 19851                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19852                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19853                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19854                                  ;
 19855                                  ; Inputs : None
 19856                                  ;
 19857                                  ; Outputs : None
 19858                                  ;
 19859                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19860                                  ;
 19861                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19862                                  
 19863                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19864                                  
 19865                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 19866 00000A8D 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 19867 00000A8F 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 19868                                  
 19869                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 19870                                  
 19871                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19872 00000A91 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 19873                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 19874 00000A94 2EA3[690A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 19875 00000A98 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 19876                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19877 00000A9B 2EA3[6B0A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19878                                  
 19879                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19880                                  
 19881 00000A9F B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 19882                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 19883                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19884 00000AA1 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 19885 00000AA4 CD21                    	int	21h
 19886                                  
 19887                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 19888                                  
 19889 00000AA6 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena

 19988                                  
 19989                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19990                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19991                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19992                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19993                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19994                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19995                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19996                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19997                                  ;								      ;I070
 19998                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19999                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 20000                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20001                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 20002                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 20003                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 20004                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 20005                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 20006                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 20007                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 20008                                  ;								      ;I070
 20009                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 20010                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20011                                  
 20012                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20013                                  	; ds = cs
 20014

 20016 00000B36 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 20017 00000B38 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 20018 00000B3A B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 20019 00000B3C D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20020 00000B3E B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20021 00000B40 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20022 00000B42 05[150B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 20023 00000B45 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 20024                                  
 20025                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 20026                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20027                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax

 21040                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21041                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21042                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21043                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21044                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21045                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21046                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21047                                  ;
 21048                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21049                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21050                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21051                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21052                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21053                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21054                                  ;
 21055                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21056                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21057                                  ;
 21058                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21059                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21060                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21061                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21062                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21063                                  ;
 21064                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21065                                  ;
 21066                                  ;			  none.
 21067                                  
 21068                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21069                                  ;
 21070                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21071                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21072                                  
 21073                                  	; 24/10/2022

 21228                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY
 21229                                  		; BX = number of 16-byte paragraphs desired
 21230 00000FF6 A3[E003]                	mov	[memhi],ax		; start of the allocated memory
 21231 00000FF9 C706[DE03]0000          	mov	word [memlo],0		;  to be used next.
 21232                                  
 21233                                  ;;;; at this moment,memory from [memhi]:0 to top-of-the memory is
 21234                                  ;;;; allocated.
 21235                                  ;;;; to protect sysinit,confbot module (from confbot (or =alloclim at
 21236                                  ;;;; this time) to the top-of-the memory),here we are going to
 21237                                  ;;;; 1). "setblock" from memhi to confbot.
 21238                                  ;;;; 2). "alloc" from confbot to the top of the memory.
 21239                                  ;;;; 3). "free alloc memory" from memhi to confbot.
 21240                                  
 21241                                  ;memory allocation for sysinit,confbot module.
 21242                                  
 21243 00000FFF 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 21244                                  	;mov	bx,[CONFBOT]
 21245                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21246 00001001 8B1E[A102]              	mov	bx,[top_of_cdss]
 21247 00001005 29C3                    	sub	bx,ax			; confbot - memhi
 21248 00001007 4B                      	dec	bx			; make a room for the memory block id.
 21249 00001008 4B                      	dec	bx			; make sure!!!.
 21250 00001009 B44A                    	mov	ah,4Ah ; SETBLOCK
 21251 0000100B CD21                    	int	21h			; this will free (confbot to top of memory)
 21252                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ADJUST MEMORY BLOCK SIZE (SETBLOCK)
 21253                                  		; ES = segment address of block to change
 21254                                  		; BX = new size in paragraphs
 21255 0000100D BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 21256 00001010 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 21257 00001012 CD21                    	int	21h
 21258 00001014 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 21259 00001016 CD21                    	int	21h			; allocate (confbot to top of memory)
 21260                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY
 21261                                  		; BX = number of 16-byte paragraphs desired
 21262 00001018 A3[E403]                	mov	[area],ax		; save allocated memory segment.
 21263                                  					; need this to free this area for command.com.
 21264 0000101B 8E06[E003]              	mov	es,[memhi]
 21265 0000101F B449                    	mov	ah,49h			; free allocated memory.
 21266 00001021 CD21                    	int	21h			; free (memhi to confbot(=area))
 21267                                  		; DOS - 2+ - FREE MEMORY
 21268                                  		; ES = segment address of area to be freed
 21269                                  endfile_ret:
 21270 00001023 C3                      	retn
 21271                                  
 21272                                  ; End of "EndFile" DOS structure configuration.
 21273                                  
 21274                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21275                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21276                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 21277                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21278                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21279                                  ;
 21280                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21281                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21282                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21283                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21284                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21285                                  ; program).
 21286                                  
 21287                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 21288                                  
 21289                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21290                                  
 21291 00001024 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21292                                  
 21293                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21294                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21295                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21296                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21297                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21298                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21299                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21300                                  ; carridge return.
 21301                                  
 21302                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21303                                  ;character after =.
 21304                                  
 21305 00001025 06                      	push	es
 21306 00001026 1E                      	push	ds
 21307 00001027 07                      	pop	es
 21308 00001028 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 21309 00001029 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 21310                                  
 21311 0000102B 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21312 0000102D FC                      	cld
 21313 0000102E 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 21314 00001034 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 21315                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 21316 00001037 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 21317 00001038 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 21318 0000103A 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 21319 0000103C EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 21320                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 21321 0000103E AC                      	lodsb
 21322 0000103F 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 21323 00001042 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 21324 00001044 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 21325 00001046 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 21326 00001048 47                      	inc	di
 21327 00001049 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 21328                                  done_installparm:
 21329 0000104B 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 21330 00001050 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 21331 00001053 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 21332 00001055 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 21333                                  					; starts with cr.
 21334                                  install_seg_set:
 21335 0000105B 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 21336 00001062 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.
 21337                                  
 21338                                  ;---------------------------------------------------M067----------------
 21339                                  ;
 21340                                  ; 	the environment pointer is made 0. so the current environment ptr.
 21341                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.
 21342                                  ;
 21343                                  ; 	mov	cs:[instexe.exec0_environ],0 ; set the environment seg.
 21344                                  ;
 21345                                  ; 	instexe.exec0_environ need not be initialized to 0 above. It was
 21346                                  ; 	done as a fix for bug #529. The actual bug was in NLSFUNC and
 21347                                  ; 	was fixed. 
 21348                                  ;
 21349                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21350                                  
 21351                                  ;;ifdef   MULTI_CONFIG
 21352                                  
 21353                                  ; If there's any environment data in "config_wrkseg", pass to app
 21354

 21364                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21365                                  	;mov	[cs:iexec.environ],cx
 21366                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21367 00001064 2EA3[BE03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.environ],ax	
 21368                                  
 21369                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_com_line+2],ax ; set the seg.
 21370 00001068 2EA3[C203]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_line+2],ax
 21371                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_5c_fcb+2],ax
 21372 0000106C 2EA3[C603]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_5c_fcb+2],ax
 21373                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_6c_fcb+2],ax
 21374 00001070 2EA3[CA03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_6c_fcb+2],ax
 21375 00001074 E86E00                  	call	sum_up
 21376 00001077 26A3[5603]              	mov	[es:checksum],ax	; save the value of the sum
 21377 0000107B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21378 0000107D B44B                    	mov	ah,4Bh ; EXEC		; load/exec
 21379 0000107F BB[BE03]                	mov	bx,instexe		; es:bx -> parm block.
 21380 00001082 06                      	push	es			; save es,ds for load/exec
 21381 00001083 1E                      	push	ds			; these registers will be restored in sysinit_base.
 21382 00001084 2EFF2E[4E03]            	jmp	far [cs:sysinit_base_ptr] ; jmp to sysinit_base to execute
 21383                                  					; load/exec function and check sum.
 21384                                  
 21385                                  ;----------------------------------------
 21386                                  
 21387                                  ;j.k. this is the returning address from sysinit_base.
 21388                                  
 21389                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 21390                                  
 21391                                  sysinitptr:				; returning far address from sysinit_base
 21392 00001089 5E                      	pop	si			; restore si for config.sys file.
 21393 0000108A 06                      	push	es
 21394 0000108B 1E                      	push	ds
 21395 0000108C 07                      	pop	es
 21396 0000108D 1F                      	pop	ds			; now ds - sysinitseg, es - confbot
 21397 0000108E 7306                            jnc     short install_exit_ret
 21398

 21400 00001091 E8CA21                  	call	badload 		; es:si-> path,filename,0.
 21401 00001094 5E                      	pop	si

 21411

 21413                                  ;SYSINIT:1142h:
 21414 00001096 B44D                    	mov     ah,4Dh
 21415 00001098 CD21                    	int     21h             ; DOS - 2+ - GET EXIT CODE OF SUBPROGRAM (WAIT)
 21416 0000109A 80FC03                  	cmp     ah,3

 21424                                  
 21425                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21426                                  ;
 21427                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21428                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21429                                  ;
 21430                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21431                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21432                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21433                                  
 21434                                  ParaRound:
 21435 000010A4 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21436 000010A7 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21437 000010A9 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21438 000010AB D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21439 000010AD D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21440 000010AF C3                      	retn

 21442                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21443                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21444                                  ;
 21445                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21446                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21447                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21448                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21449                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21450                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21451                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21452                                  ;
 21453                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21454                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21455                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21456                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21457                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21458                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21459                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21460                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21461                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21462                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21463                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21464                                  ;
 21465                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21466                                  
 21467                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21468                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21469                                  sysinit_base:				
 21470 000010B0 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21471 000010B5 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21472 000010BA CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21473 000010BC 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21474 000010C1 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21475 000010C6 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21476 000010C7 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21477 000010C8 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21478                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21479                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21480 000010CA E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21481 000010CD 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21482 000010D2 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21483                                  
 21484                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21485                                  
 21486 000010D4 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21487 000010D6 0E                      	push	cs
 21488 000010D7 1F                      	pop	ds
 21489 000010D8 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21490 000010DB CD21                    	int	21h
 21491                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21492                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21493                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21494                                  _stall: 
 21495                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21496 000010DD F4                      	hlt 
 21497                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21498                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21499 000010DE EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21500                                  
 21501                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21502 000010E0 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21503                                  
 21504                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21505                                  
 21506                                  sum_up:
 21507                                  
 21508                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21509                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21510                                  ;
 21511                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21512                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21513                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21514                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21515                                  ;
 21516                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21517                                  
 21518 000010E5 1E                      	push	ds
 21519                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21520                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21521 000010E6 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21522 000010EA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21523 000010EC 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21524 000010EE 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21525 000010F0 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21526                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21527 000010F5 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21528 000010F7 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21529                                  sum1:
 21530 000010F9 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21531 000010FB 46                      	inc	si
 21532 000010FC 46                      	inc	si
 21533 000010FD E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21534                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21535                                  sum_sys_code:
 21536                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21537 000010FF BEFE10                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21538                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21539                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21540                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21541                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21542                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21543                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21544                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21545 00001102 B9[F037]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21546 00001105 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21547 00001107 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21548                                  sum2:
 21549 00001109 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21550 0000110C 46                      	inc	si
 21551 0000110D 46                      	inc	si
 21552 0000110E E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21553 00001110 1F                      	pop	ds
 21554 00001111 C3                      	retn
 21555                                  
 21556                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21557                                  
 21558                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21559                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 21560 00001112 0000                    	dw	0
 21561                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)

 21577                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21578                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21579                                  ;
 21580                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21581                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21582                                  ;
 21583                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21584                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21585                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21586                                  ;
 21587                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21588                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21589                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21590                                  
 21591                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21592                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 21593                                  
 21594                                  set_buffer:
 21595 00001131 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 21596 00001133 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 21597 00001136 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1

 21599                                  	; 17/09/2023
 21600 00001138 FEC2                    	inc	dl ; mov dl,1

 21606 0000113C 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 21607                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 21608 0000113F C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 21609                                  
 21610 00001144 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 21611 00001146 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 21612 0000114B 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 21613                                  
 21614                                  ;	for each buffer
 21615                                  
 21616                                  nxt_buff:
 21617 0000114C E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 21618 0000114F 89C7                    	mov	di,ax

 21620

 21622

 21624                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 21625 00001159 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx

 21627                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 21628                                  	; 25/10/2022

 21630                                  
 21631 00001162 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMA ?
 21632 00001164 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no

 21634 00001166 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 21635 0000116A 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 21636                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 21637 0000116E C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0

 21639 00001173 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax

 21642 0000117A 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 21643                                  set_buff_2:

 21652                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21653                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21654                                  ;
 21655                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21656                                  ;
 21657                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21658                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21659                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21660                                  
 21661                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21662                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21663 0000118B 53                      	push	bx
 21664 0000118C 52                      	push	dx
 21665 0000118D 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21666 00001191 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21667                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21668 00001196 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21669                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21670                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21671                                  	; 12/12/2022

 21673 0000119B 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21674 0000119D B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h

 21722                                  
 21723                                  ; ======================================================================
 21724                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21725                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21726                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21727                                  
 21728                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21729                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21730                                  ;
 21731                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21732                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21733                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21734                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21735                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21736                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21737                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21738                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21739                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21740                                  ;
 21741                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21742                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21743                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21744                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21745                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21746                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21747                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21748                                  ;	conditions:
 21749                                  ;
 21750                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21751                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21752                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21753                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21754                                  ;
 21755                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21756                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21757                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21758                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21759                                  ;
 21760                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21761                                  ;
 21762                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21763                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21764                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21765                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21766                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21767                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21768                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21769                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21770                                  ;
 21771                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21772                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21773                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21774                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21775                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21776                                  ;
 21777                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21778                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21779                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21780                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21781                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21782                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21783                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21784                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21785                                  ;
 21786                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21787                                  
 21788                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21789                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21790                                  
 21791                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21792                                  stackinit:
 21793 000011D8 50                      	push	ax
 21794 000011D9 1E                      	push	ds
 21795 000011DA 06                      	push	es
 21796 000011DB 53                      	push	bx
 21797 000011DC 51                      	push	cx
 21798 000011DD 52                      	push	dx
 21799 000011DE 57                      	push	di
 21800 000011DF 56                      	push	si
 21801 000011E0 55                      	push	bp
 21802                                  
 21803                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21804                                  
 21805                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21806                                  	; ds = cs
 21807 000011E1 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21808 000011E4 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21809                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21810                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21811                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21812 000011E6 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21813                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 21814 000011EA A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 21815 000011ED 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21816                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21817 000011F1 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21818                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21819                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21820                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 21821 000011F4 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21822                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21823 000011F8 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 21824 000011FA A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 21825                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21826                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21827                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 21828 000011FD 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 21829                                  
 21830                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 21831                                  
 21832                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 21833                                  
 21834                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 21835                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21836                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 21837 00001201 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 21838                                  
 21839                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 21840                                  
 21841 00001206 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 21842                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]

 21845 00001209 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21846 0000120B 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 21847 0000120D 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 21848 00001211 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21849 00001213 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 21850                                  
 21851                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 21852                                  
 21853 00001216 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 21854 0000121B 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 21855 0000121F F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21856 00001221 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 21857 00001223 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax

 21859 00001226 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 21860                                  
 21861                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 21862                                  
 21863 00001227 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 21864 0000122B FC                      	cld
 21865 0000122C F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 21866                                  
 21867 0000122E 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 21868                                  
 21869                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 21870                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 21871                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 21872                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 21873                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry

 22630                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22631                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22632                                  
 22633                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22634                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22635                                  
 22636                                  new_init_loop:
 22637                                  
 22638                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22639                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22640                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22641                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22642                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22643                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22644                                  
 22645 000013CA 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22646 000013CD 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22647 000013CF 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22648 000013D3 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22649                                  
 22650 000013D6 1E                      	push	ds
 22651                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22652                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22653                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22654 000013D7 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22655 000013DA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22656 000013DC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22657 000013DF 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22658 000013E1 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22659 000013E5 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 22660 000013E8 1F                      	pop	ds
 22661                                  
 22662 000013E9 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22663 000013EC 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22664 000013F0 C3                      	retn
 22665                                  
 22666                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22667                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22668                                  
 22669                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22670                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22671                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22672                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22673                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22674                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22675                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22676                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22677                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22678                                  
 22679                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22680                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22681                                  ; 04/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22682                                  ; (SYSINIT:176Ch)
 22683                                  
 22684                                  ; 04/09/2023 - PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM (SYSINIT:1944h)
 22685                                  
 22686                                  setdevmark:
 22687                                  
 22688                                  	; 04/09/2023
 22689                                  	;push	es
 22690                                  	;push	cx
 22691                                  
 22692 000013F1 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22693 000013F6 2E890E[0E14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22694 000013FB 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22695                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22696                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22697 000013FD 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22698 00001401 41                      	inc	cx
 22699                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22700 00001402 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22701                                  
 22702                                  	; 04/09/2023
 22703                                  	;pop	cx
 22704                                  	;pop	es
 22705                                  	
 22706 00001407 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22707 0000140C C3                      	retn
