 22907                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22908                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 22909                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 22910                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22911                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22912                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22913                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 22914                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 22915                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22916                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22917                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22918                                  
 22919                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 22920                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22921 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 22922 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 22923 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 22924                                  endstruc
 22925                                  
 22926                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 22927                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 22928                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 22929                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 22930                                  
 22931                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22932                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 22933                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 22934                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 22935                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 22936                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 22937                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 22938                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 22939                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 22940                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22941                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 22942                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22943                                  
 22944                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22945                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22946 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22947 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22948 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22949                                  endstruc
 22950                                  
 22951                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22952                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22953                                  ;
 22954                                  ;
 22955                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22956                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22957                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22958                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22959                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22960                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22961                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22962                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22963                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22964                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22965                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22966                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22967                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22968                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22969                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22970                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22971                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22972                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22973                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22974                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22975                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22976                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22977                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22978                                  ;	   :
 22979                                  ;
 22980                                  ;Note:
 22981                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22982                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22983                                  ;
 22984                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22985                                  ;
 22986                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22987                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22988                                  ;
 22989                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22990                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22991                                  ;
 22992                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22993                                  ;
 22994                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22995                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22996                                  ;
 22997                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22998                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22999                                  ;
 23000                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23001                                  ;
 23002                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23003                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23004                                  ;
 23005                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23006                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23007                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23008                                  ;
 23009                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23010                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23011                                  ;
 23012                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23013                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23014                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23015                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23016                                  
 23017                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23018                                  
 23019                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23020                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23021                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23022                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23023                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23024                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23025                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23026                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23027                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23028                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23029                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23030                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23031                                  
 23032                                  ;**** Function flags
 23033                                  
 23034                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23035                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23036                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23037                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23038                                  
 23039                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23040                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23041 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23042 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23043 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23044 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23045 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23046 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23047                                  endstruc
 23048                                  
 23049                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23050                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23051                                  ;
 23052                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23053                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23054                                  ;	     +-
 23055                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23056                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23057                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23058                                  ;	     |	:
 23059                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23060                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23061                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23062                                  ;	     |	:
 23063                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23064                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23065                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23066                                  ;	     +-	:
 23067                                  ;
 23068                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23069                                  ;
 23070                                  ;Note:
 23071                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23072                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23073                                  ;
 23074                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23075                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23076                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23077                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23078                                  
 23079                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23080                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23081                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23082                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23083                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23084                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23085                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23086                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23087                                  
 23088                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23089 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23090 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23091 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23092 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23093 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23094                                  endstruc
 23095                                  
 23096                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23097                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23098                                  ;
 23099                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23100                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23101                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23102                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23103                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23104                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23105                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23106                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23107                                  ;
 23108                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23109                                  ;
 23110                                  ;            +-
 23111                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23112                                  ;	    | or
 23113                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23114                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23115                                  ;	    | or
 23116                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23117                                  ;	    | or
 23118                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23119                                  ;	    | or
 23120                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23121                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23122                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23123                                  ;	    | or
 23124                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23125                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23126                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23127                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23128                                  ;	    +-
 23129                                  ;
 23130                                  ;
 23131                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23132                                  ;      list.
 23133                                  ;
 23134                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23135                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23136                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23137                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23138                                  
 23139                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 23140                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 23141 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 23142 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 23143 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23144 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23145                                  endstruc
 23146                                  
 23147                                  ;--------------------------------
 23148                                  ;**** values for the type field in the result block
 23149                                  
 23150                                  _$P_EOL		   equ	0		;AN000; End of line
 23151                                  _$P_Number	   equ	1		;AN000; Number
 23152                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 23153                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 23154                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 23155                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 23156                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 23157                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 23158                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 23159                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 23160                                  
 23161                                  _$P_No_Tag	   equ	0FFh		;AN000; No ITEM_TAG found
 23162                                  
 23163                                  ;**** Return code
 23164                                  ;
 23165                                  ; following return code will be returned in the AX register.
 23166                                  
 23167                                  _$P_No_Error	   equ	0		;AN000; No error
 23168                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 23169                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 23170                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 23171                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 23172                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 23173                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 23174                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 23175                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 23176                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 23260                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23261                                  ; SysParse;
 23262                                  ;
 23263                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23264                                  ;
 23265                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23266                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23267                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23268                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23269                                  ;
 23270                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23271                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23272                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23273                                  ;
 23274                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23275                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23276                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23277                                  ;
 23278                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23279                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23280                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23281                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23282                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23283                                  ;
 23284                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23285                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23286                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23287                                  ;
 23288                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23289                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23290                                  ;
 23291                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23292                                  ;
 23293                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23294                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23295                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23296                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23297                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23298                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23299                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23300                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23301                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23302                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23303                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23304                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23305                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23306                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23307                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23308                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23309                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23310                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23311                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23312                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23313                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23314                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23315                                  ;					  (tm12)

 23317                                  ;					  (tm13)

 23319                                  ;					  (tm14)

 23321                                  ;					  (tm15)

 23323                                  
 23324                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23325                                  
 23326                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23327                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23328                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23329                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23330                                  
 23331                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23332                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23333                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23334                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23335                                  ;
 23336                                  
 23337                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23338                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23339                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23340                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23341                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23342                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23343                                  
 23344                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23345                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23346                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23347                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23348                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23349                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23350                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23351                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23352                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23353                                  
 23354                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23355                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23356                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 23357                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 23358                                  ;	     segment.

 23536                                  
 23537                                  _$P_Pack_Loop:				;AN000;
 23538 00001517 AC                      	lodsb				;AN000; Pick a operand from buffer
 23539 00001518 E8FA06                  	call	_$P_Chk_Switch		;AN000; Check switch character

 23957                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23958                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23959                                  ;
 23960                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23961                                  ;
 23962                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23963                                  ;	    AL = type
 23964                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23965                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23966                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23967                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23968                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23969                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23970                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23971                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23972                                  ;
 23973                                  ; Output:   None
 23974                                  ;
 23975                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23976                                  ;
 23977                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 23978                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23979                                  
 23980                                  _$P_Fill_Result:

 24196                                  ; _$P_Remove_Colon;
 24197                                  ;
 24198                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 24199                                  ;
 24200                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed
 24201                                  ;
 24202                                  ; Output:   None
 24203                                  ;
 24204                                  ; Use:	_$P_Chk_DBCS

 24206                                  
 24207                                  _$P_Remove_Colon:
 24208 000017FA 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;

 24210                                  _$P_RCOL_Loop:				;AN000;
 24211 000017FC 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 24212 000017FF 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 24213 00001801 741A                    	jz	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; if yes, just exit
 24214                                  
 24215 00001803 3C3A                    	cmp	al,_$P_Colon		;AN000; is it colon ?
 24216 00001805 750D                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000;
 24217

 24219 0000180C 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000; no, then next char
 24220

 24222 00001812 EB09                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; and exit.
 24223                                  
 24224                                  _$P_RCOL00:				;AN000;
 24225 00001814 E81704                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; if not colon, then check if
 24226 00001817 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.

 24229                                  _$P_RCOL01:				;AN000;

 24232

 24239                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_String;
 24240                                  ;
 24241                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 24242                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 24243                                  ;
 24244                                  ; Input:    AL = 2 : Use character table
 24245                                  ;	    AL = 4 : Use file table
 24246                                  ;	    cs:SI points to string buffer to be capitalized
 24247                                  ;
 24248                                  ; Output:   None
 24249                                  ;
 24250                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24251                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24252                                  
 24253                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_String:
 24254 00001820 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24255 00001821 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24256 00001822 88C2                    	mov	dl,al			;AN000; save info id
 24257                                  
 24258                                  _$P_DCS_Loop:				;AN000;
 24259 00001824 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; load charater and
 24260 00001827 E80404                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; check if DBCS leading byte
 24261 0000182A 720C                    	jc	short _$P_DCS00		;AN000; if yes, do not need CAPS
 24262                                  
 24263 0000182C 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 24264 0000182E 740C                    	jz	short _$P_DCS_Exit	;AN000; then exit.
 24265                                  
 24266 00001830 E80C00                  	call	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char 	;AN000; Here a SBCS char need to be CAPS
 24267 00001833 2E8804                  	mov	[cs:si],al		;AN000; stored upper case char to buffer
 24268 00001836 EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS01		;AN000; process next
 24269                                  _$P_DCS00:				;AN000;
 24270 00001838 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip DBCS leading and trailing byte
 24271                                  _$P_DCS01:				;AN000;
 24272 00001839 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si point to next byte
 24273 0000183A EBE8                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 24274                                  _$P_DCS_Exit:				;AN000;
 24275 0000183C 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 24276 0000183D 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 24277 0000183E C3                      	retn

 24625                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24626                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 24627                                  ;
 24628                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 24629                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 24630                                  ;
 24631                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 24632                                  ;
 24633                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 24634                                  ;
 24635                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24636                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24637                                  
 24638                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24639                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 24640 00001987 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 24641 00001988 2EF606[2314]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 24642 0000198E 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 24643                                  
 24644 00001990 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24645 00001991 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24646                                  
 24647                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24648 00001992 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24649 00001993 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24650                                  
 24651 00001995 F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24652 00001996 C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24653                                  
 24654                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 24655                                  _$P_0099Err: ; 14/08/2023
 24656 00001997 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24657                                  _$P_0099Err2: ; 14/08/2023
 24658 00001998 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25363                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25364                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25365                                  ;
 25366                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25367                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25368                                  ;
 25369                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25370                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25371                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25372                                  ;
 25373                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25374                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25375                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25376                                  
 25377                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25378                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25379                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25380                                  ;
 25381                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25382                                  
 25383                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25384                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25385                                  
 25386                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25387                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25388                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25389                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25390 00001C15 BD[2C14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 25391                                  
 25392                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25393 00001C18 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25394 00001C1A 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25395                                  
 25396                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25397 00001C1C 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25398 00001C1E 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25399                                  
 25400 00001C20 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25401                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25402                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25403 00001C21 C3                      	retn
 25404                                  
 25405                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25406                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25407                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25408                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25409                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25410                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25411                                  
 25412                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25413                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25414 00001C22 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25415 00001C24 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25416                                  
 25417 00001C26 2E800E[2314]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25418                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25419                                  
 25420                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25421                                  	; cf=0
 25422                                  	;retn
 25423                                  
 25424                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25425                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25426                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25427 00001C2C F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25428                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25429                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25430 00001C2D C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25474 00001C4D 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25475 00001C4E 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25476 00001C4F 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25477 00001C50 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25478 00001C51 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25479 00001C52 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25480 00001C53 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25481                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25482 00001C55 2E8936[1E14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25483 00001C5A 2E891E[2014]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25484                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25485                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25486                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25487                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25488 00001C5F 2EC536[1E14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 25489                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25490 00001C64 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25491 00001C67 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25492 00001C69 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25493 00001C6B 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25494 00001C6D 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25495 00001C70 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25496 00001C72 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25497 00001C73 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25498                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25499 00001C75 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25500 00001C76 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25501                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25502 00001C77 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25503                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25504                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25505                                  	; cf=0
 25506                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25507                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25508 00001C79 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25509 00001C7A 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25510 00001C7B 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25511 00001C7C C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25523                                  struc p_parms
 25524 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?
 25525 00000002 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; an extra delimiter list
 25526 00000003 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; length is 1
 25527 00000004 ??                      	resb 	1	; db ';' ; delimiter
 25528                                  .size:
 25529                                  endstruc
 25530                                  
 25531                                  struc p_pos
 25532 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; numeric value??
 25533 00000002 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; function
 25534 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer
 25535                                  
 25536                                  ; note: by defining result_val before this structure, we could remove
 25537                                  ;  the "result_val" from every structure invocation
 25538                                  
 25539 00000006 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; value list
 25540 00000008 ??                      	resb	1	; db 0	; no switches/keywords
 25541                                  .size:
 25542                                  endstruc
 25543                                  
 25544                                  struc	p_range
 25545 00000000 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; range definition
 25546 00000001 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; 1 definition of range
 25547 00000002 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; item tag for this range
 25548 00000003 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric min
 25549 00000007 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric max
 25550                                  .size:
 25551                                  endstruc

 26067                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26068                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26069                                  
 26070                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26071                                  ;
 26072                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26073                                  ;
 26074                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26075                                  ;
 26076                                  ;   Modification log:
 26077                                  ;
 26078                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26079                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26080                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26081                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26082                                  ;
 26083                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26084                                  ;
 26085                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26086                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26087                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26088                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26089                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26090                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26091                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26092                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26093                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26094                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26095                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26096                                  ;
 26097                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26098                                  
 26099                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26100                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26101                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26102                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26103                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26104                                  
 26105                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26106                                  
 26107                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26108                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26109                                  
 26110                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26111                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26112                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26113                                  
 26114                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26115                                  ;
 26116                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26117                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26118                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 26119                                  ;	           line.
 26120                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26121                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26122                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26123                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26124                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26125                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26126                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 26127                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26128                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26129                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26130                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26131                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26132                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26133                                  ;	           for details).
 26134                                  
 26135                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 26136                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 26137                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 26138                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 26139                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26140                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26141                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 26142                                  fm_strat: db	0
 26143                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 26144                                  
 26145                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26146                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26147                                  
 26148                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26149                                  
 26150                                  %endif
 26151                                  
 26152                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 26153

 26156                                  
 26157                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26158                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 26159                                  
 26160                                  		;public	DevEntry
 26161                                  
 26162 00001E60 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 26163 00001E62 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 26164 00001E64 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 26165 00001E66 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 26166 00001E6A 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 26167                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 26168                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 26169                                  ;
 26170 00001E6E 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 26171 00001E6F 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 26172 00001E71 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 26173 00001E73 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 26174                                  ;

 26176                                  ;
 26177 00001E79 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 26178 00001E7B 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 26179                                  ;

 26181                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB

 26183                                  ;
 26184 00001E80 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12 ?
 26185 00001E81 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)

 26187                                  ;

 26190 00001E8E 00000000                DevCmdLine:	dd	0	; Current Command line
 26191 00001E92 00                      DevSavedDelim:	db	0	; The delimiter which was replaced with null

 26205                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26206                                  ;
 26207                                  ; procedure : doconf
 26208                                  ;
 26209                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 26210                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 26211                                  ;
 26212                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26213                                  
 26214                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26215                                  doconf:
 26216 00001E93 0E                      	push	cs
 26217 00001E94 1F                      	pop	ds
 26218                                  
 26219 00001E95 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 26220                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 26221 00001E98 CD21                    	int	21h
 26222 00001E9A 8816[AA02]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 26223                                  
 26224                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26225                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26226                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 26227                                  ;	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 26228                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 26229                                  
 26230 00001E9E BA[0333]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 26231 00001EA1 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 26232                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 26233 00001EA4 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 26234 00001EA5 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 26235 00001EA7 7306                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 26236                                  
 26237                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26238                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26239                                  ;      	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 26240                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 26241                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 26242 00001EA9 C606[4903]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 26243 00001EAE C3                      	retn
 26244                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 26245 00001EAF 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 26246 00001EB1 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26247 00001EB3 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26248                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 26249 00001EB5 B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 26250 00001EB8 CD21                    	int	21h
 26251 00001EBA A3[D203]                	mov	[count],ax
 26252                                  
 26253 00001EBD 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26254                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 26255 00001EBF B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 26256 00001EC2 CD21                    	int	21h
 26257                                  
 26258                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 26259                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26260 00001EC4 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 26261                                  
 26262 00001EC8 A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 26263 00001ECB A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 26264 00001ECE E8D3F1                  	call	ParaRound
 26265 00001ED1 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 26266                                  
 26267                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26268                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26269                                  ;;
 26270                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 26271                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 26272                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 26273                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 26274                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 26275                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 26276                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 26277                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 26278                                  ;;
 26279                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 26280                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 26281                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 26282                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 26283                                  
 26284 00001ED3 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 26285                                  	
 26286                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 26287                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 26288                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26289 00001ED6 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 26290 00001EDA E8E8EC                  	call    TempCDS 
 26291                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26292                                  	; ds <> cs 
 26293 00001EDD 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 26294                                   
 26295 00001EE2 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 26296 00001EE4 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 26297                                  
 26298 00001EE6 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26299 00001EE8 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 26300 00001EED B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 26301                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 26302 00001EEF F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 26303 00001EF0 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 26304 00001EF2 9C                      	pushf
 26305                                  
 26306                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 26307                                  
 26308 00001EF3 50                      	push	ax
 26309 00001EF4 57                      	push	di
 26310 00001EF5 51                      	push	cx
 26311 00001EF6 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 26312 00001EF8 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 26313 00001EFA E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 26314 00001EFC F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 26315 00001EFE 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 26316                                  
 26317                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 26318                                  
 26319 00001F00 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 26320                                  
 26321                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 26322                                  
 26323                                  puteol:
 26324 00001F01 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 26325 00001F03 AA                      	stosb
 26326 00001F04 B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 26327 00001F06 AA                      	stosb
 26328 00001F07 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 26329                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26330                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 26331                                  
 26332                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 26333                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26334 00001F09 0E                      	push	cs
 26335 00001F0A 1F                      	pop	ds
 26336                                  
 26337 00001F0B 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 26338                                  
 26339 00001F0F 59                      	pop	cx
 26340 00001F10 5F                      	pop	di
 26341 00001F11 58                      	pop	ax
 26342                                  
 26343                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26344                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26345                                  	;push	cs
 26346                                  	;pop	ds
 26347                                  
 26348 00001F12 50                      	push	ax
 26349                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 26350 00001F13 B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 26351 00001F15 CD21                    	int	21h
 26352 00001F17 58                      	pop	ax
 26353 00001F18 9D                      	popf
 26354 00001F19 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 26355 00001F1B 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 26356 00001F1D 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 26357                                  conferr:
 26358 00001F1F BA[0333]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 26359 00001F22 E83513                  	call	badfil
 26360                                  endconv:
 26361 00001F25 C3                      	retn
 26362                                  
 26363                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26364                                  ;
 26365                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 26366                                  ;
 26367                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 26368                                  ;
 26369                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26370                                  
 26371                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26372                                  multi_pass:
 26373 00001F26 0E                      	push	cs
 26374 00001F27 1F                      	pop	ds
 26375                                  
 26376 00001F28 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 26377                                  ;jae_endconv:
 26378 00001F2D 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 26379                                  
 26380                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 26381                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26382 00001F2F FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 26383 00001F33 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 26384                                  
 26385 00001F34 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 26386 00001F38 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 26387 00001F3C 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 26388 00001F3E 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 26389 00001F42 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 26390                                  
 26391 00001F46 E89510                  	call	getchr
 26392 00001F49 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 26393                                  
 26394                                  getcom:
 26395 00001F4B E8790E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 26396 00001F4E E88D10                  	call	getchr
 26397                                  conflp: 
 26398 00001F51 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 26399                                  
 26400 00001F53 FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 26401                                  
 26402 00001F57 C606[0D14]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 26403 00001F5C C606[1014]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 26404 00001F61 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 26405 00001F63 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 26406                                  
 26407                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26408                                  %if 0
 26409                                  
 26410                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26411                                  
 26412                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 26413                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 26414                                  
 26415                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 26416                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 26417                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 26418                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 26419                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 26420                                  
 26421                                          push    ax                      ;
 26422                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26423                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26424                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26425                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26426                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26427                                          pop     ax
 26428                                  ;
 26429                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26430                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26431                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26432                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26433                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26434                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26435                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26436                                  ;   spot.
 26437                                  ;
 26438                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26439                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26440                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26441                                  ;   retrieved.
 26442                                  ;
 26443                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 26444                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26445                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26446                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26447                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 26448                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 26449                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26450                                  final:                                  ;
 26451                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 26452                                  not_final:                              ;
 26453                                  ;endif
 26454                                  
 26455                                  %endif
 26456 00001F65 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 26457 00001F67 E87410                  	call	getchr
 26458 00001F6A 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 26459                                  
 26460 00001F6C 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 26461                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 26462                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26463 00001F71 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 26464 00001F73 E9FB06                  	jmp	badop
 26465                                  	
 26466                                  coff:	
 26467                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26468                                  	; ds = cs
 26469                                  	;push	cs
 26470                                  	;pop	ds
 26471 00001F76 E85C10                  	call	newline
 26472 00001F79 EBD6                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 26473                                  
 26474                                  blank_line:
 26475 00001F7B E86010                  	call	getchr
 26476 00001F7E EBD1                    	jmp	short conflp
 26477                                  
 26478                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26479                                  ; 11/12/2022
 26480                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 26481                                  ;coff_p:
 26482                                  	;push	cs
 26483                                  	;pop	ds
 26484                                  
 26485                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 26486                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 26487                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 26488                                  ;install= command.
 26489                                  
 26490                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26491                                  ;install command
 26492                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26493                                  
 26494                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26495                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 26496                                  tryi:
 26497 00001F80 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 26498 00001F85 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 26499 00001F87 E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 26500                                  not_init_pass:
 26501 00001F8A 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=

 26504 00001F8F 74E5                    	je	short coff

 26515 00001F98 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'

 26523                                  ;       but don't process them now.

 26526                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.

 26533 00001FA7 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 26534                                  
 26535                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26536                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
