 33040                                  ;
 33041                                  ; procedure : UnlinkUMB
 33042                                  ;
 33043                                  ;	Unlinks the UMBs from the DOS arena chain
 33044                                  ;
 33045                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33046                                  
 33047                                  UnlinkUMB:
 33048                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33049                                  	; ds = cs
 33050 00002BDF 1E                      	push	ds
 33051 00002BE0 06                      	push	es
 33052                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33053 00002BE1 803E[8B1E]00            	cmp	byte [FirstUMBLinked],0
 33054                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:FirstUMBLinked],0
 33055 00002BE6 7420                    	je	short ulu_x		; nothing to unlink
 33056                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33057 00002BE8 8E06[8C1E]              	mov	es,[DevDOSData]
 33058                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevDOSData]	; get DOS data seg
 33059 00002BEC 268E1E2400              	mov	ds,[es:DOS_ARENA]
 33060 00002BF1 268B3E8C00              	mov	di,[es:UMB_ARENA]
 33061                                  ulu_next:
 33062 00002BF6 E83BFF                  	call	get_next
 33063 00002BF9 720D                    	jc	short ulu_x
 33064 00002BFB 39C7                    	cmp	di,ax			; is the next one UMB ?
 33065 00002BFD 7404                    	je	short ulu_found
 33066 00002BFF 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 33067 00002C01 EBF3                    	jmp	short ulu_next
 33068                                  ulu_found:
 33069                                  	;mov	byte [0],'Z'
 33070 00002C03 C60600005A              	mov     byte [ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 33071                                  ulu_x:
 33072 00002C08 07                      	pop	es
 33073 00002C09 1F                      	pop	ds
 33074 00002C0A C3                      	retn

 33076                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 33077                                  ; SYSINIT2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 33078                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 33079                                  ; 14/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33080                                  
 33081                                  ; Multiple configuration block support  Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 33082                                  ;
 33083                                  ; Summary:
 33084                                  ;
 33085                                  ;   The procedure "organize" crunches the in-memory copy of config.sys
 33086                                  ;   into lines delimited by CR/LF (sometimes no CR, but *always* an LF)
 33087                                  ;   with the leading "keyword=" replaced by single character codes (eg, B
 33088                                  ;   for BUFFERS, D for DEVICE, Z for any unrecognized keyword); see comtab
 33089                                  ;   and/or config.inc for the full list.
 33090                                  ;
 33091                                  ;   [blockname] and INCLUDE are the major syntactical additions for multi-
 33092                                  ;   configuration support. blockname is either MENU, which contains one
 33093                                  ;   or more MENUITEM lines, an optional MENUDEFAULT (which includes optional
 33094                                  ;   time-out), or any user-defined keyword, such as NETWORK, CD-ROM, etc.
 33095                                  ;   INCLUDE allows the current block to name another block for inclusion
 33096                                  ;   during the processing phase of CONFIG.SYS. An INCLUDE is only honored
 33097                                  ;   once, precluding nasty infinite-loop scenarios. If blocks are present
 33098                                  ;   without a MENU block, then only lines inside COMMON blocks are processed.
 33099                                  ;
 33100                                  ; Example:
 33101                                  ;
 33102                                  ;   [menu]
 33103                                  ;   menuitem=misc,Miscellaneous

 33121                                  ;    1. Miscellaneous
 33122                                  ;    2. Network Configuration
 33123                                  ;
 33124                                  ;   #2 is highlighted as the default option, and will be automatically
 33125                                  ;   selected after 15 seconds. It will invoke the following lines in the
 33126                                  ;   following order:

 33129                                  ;       DEVICE=TAR
 33130                                  ;       DEVICE=FOO

 33285                                  nextswtch:
 33286                                  	cmp	al,cr			; carriage return?
 33287                                  	je	short done_line
 33288                                  	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 33289                                  	je	short put_back		; put it back and done
 33290                                  
 33291                                  ; anything less or equal to a space is ignored.
 33292                                  
 33293                                  	cmp	al,' '                  ; space?
 33294                                  	jbe	short getnext		; skip over space
 33295                                  	cmp	al,'/'
 33296                                  	je	short getparm

 33303                                  	jc	short swterr

 33306                                  	jc	short done_line
 33307                                  	jmp	short nextswtch
 33308                                  swterr:
 33309                                  	jmp	short exitpl		; exit if error
 33310

 33317                                  	jmp	short exitpl

 33325                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33326                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33327                                  	; cf=0
 33328                                  	;clc
 33329                                  	call	setdeviceparameters

 33331                                  	pop	ds

 33342                                  ; procedure : check_switch
 33343                                  ;
 33344                                  ; processes a switch in the input. it ensures that the switch is valid, and
 33345                                  ; gets the number, if any required, following the switch. the switch and the
 33346                                  ; number *must* be separated by a colon. carry is set if there is any kind of
 33347                                  ; error.
 33348                                  ;
 33349                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33350                                  
 33351                                  ; 09/09/2023
 33352                                  
 33353                                  err_swtch:
 33354 00002C5F 31CB                    	xor	bx,cx			; remove this switch from the records
 33355                                  err_check:
 33356 00002C61 F9                      	stc
 33357                                  err_chk:
 33358                                  done_swtch:	; 09/09/2023 (cf=0)
 33359 00002C62 C3                      	retn

 33471

 33474                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33475                                  	;jmp	short done_ret
 33476                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33477                                  	; cf=0

 33479                                  try_t:

 33490                                  	;jmp	short done_ret
 33491                                  	; 12/12/2022

 33611                                  
 33612                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33613                                  ;
 33614                                  ; procedure : setdeviceparameters
 33615                                  ;
 33616                                  ; setdeviceparameters sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the
 33617                                  ; system based on the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the
 33618                                  ; various form factors are present in the bpbtable. for hard files,
 33619                                  ; the recommended bpb is the same as the bpb on the drive.
 33620                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
 33621                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
 33622                                  ;
 33623                                  ;	if we return carry, the DRIVPARM will be aborted, but presently
 33624                                  ;	  we always return no carry
 33625                                  ;

 33711                                  ;	two head drives will use the mediadescriptor from the bpb
 33712                                  
 33713 00002D74 88FB                    	mov	bl,bh			; get mediadescriptor from bpb
 33714                                  
 33715                                  ;	two sided drives have two special cases to look for. One is
 33716                                  ;	   a 320K diskette (40 tracks, 8 secs per track). It uses
 33717                                  ;	   a mediaid of 0fch. The other is 1.44M, which uses only
 33718                                  ;	   one sector/cluster.
 33719                                  
 33720                                  ;	any drive with 18secs/trk, 2 heads, 80 tracks, will be assumed
 33721                                  ;	   to be a 1.44M and use only 1 sector per cluster. Any other
 33722                                  ;	   type of 2 headed drive is all set.
 33723                                  
 33724 00002D76 833E[8134]12            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],18
 33725 00002D7B 7509                    	jne	short not_144m
 33726 00002D7D 833E[7134]50            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],80
 33727 00002D82 7502                    	jne	short not_144m
 33728                                  
 33729                                  ;	We've got cyl=80, heads=2, secpertrack=18. Set cluster size to 1.
 33730                                  
 33731 00002D84 EB24                    	jmp	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 33732                                  
 33733                                  ;	check for 320K
 33734                                  
 33735                                  not_144m:
 33736 00002D86 833E[7134]28            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 33737 00002D8B 7521                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 33738 00002D8D 833E[8134]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 33739 00002D92 751A                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 33740

 33742 00002D96 EB16                    	jmp	short got_correct_mediad
 33743                                  
 33744                                  only_one_head:
 33745                                  
 33746                                  ;	if we don't have a 360K drive, then just go use 0f0h as media descr.
 33747                                  
 33748 00002D98 803E[6E34]00            	cmp	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],DEV_5INCH ; 0
 33749 00002D9D 740B                    	je	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 33750                                  
 33751                                  ;	single sided 360K drive uses either 0fch or 0feh, depending on
 33752                                  ;	  whether sectorspertrack is 8 or 9. For our purposes, anything
 33753                                  ;	  besides 8 will be considered 0fch
 33754                                  
 33755 00002D9F B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh			; single sided 9 sector media id
 33756 00002DA1 833E[8134]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 33757                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33758 00002DA6 7502                    	jne	short got_one_secperclus_drive ; okay if anything besides 8
 33759                                  
 33760 00002DA8 B3FE                    	mov	bl,0FEh			; 160K mediaid
 33761                                  
 33762                                  ;	we've either got a one sided drive, or a 1.44M drive
 33763                                  ;	  either case we'll use 1 sector per cluster instead of 2
 33764                                  
 33765                                  got_one_secperclus_drive:
 33766                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33767                                  	; ax = 2
 33768 00002DAA 48                      	dec	ax  ; ax = 1

 33770                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],1
 33771                                  
 33772                                  got_correct_mediad:
 33773 00002DAE 881E[7E34]              	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR],bl

 34084 00002E8D E8F300                  	call	skip_comment	; comment char in the filename?
 34085 00002E90 7456                    	jz	short org_put_zero ; then stop copying filename at that point
 34086                                  
 34087 00002E92 E8D800                  	call	get2
 34088 00002E95 3C2F                    	cmp	al,'/'		; a switch char? (device=filename/xxx)
 34089 00002E97 7457                    	je	short end_file_slash ; this will be the special case.
 34090                                  
 34091 00002E99 AA                      	stosb			; save the char. in buffer
 34092 00002E9A E81C01                  	call	delim
 34093 00002E9D 7459                    	jz	short end_copy_file
 34094                                  
 34095 00002E9F 3C20                    	cmp	al, ' '
 34096 00002EA1 77EA                    	ja	short org_copy_file ; keep copying
 34097 00002EA3 EB53                    	jmp	short end_copy_file ; otherwise, assume end of the filename.
 34098                                  
 34099                                  get_cmt_token:			; get the token. just max. 2 char.
 34100 00002EA5 E8C500                  	call	get2
 34101 00002EA8 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; skip white spaces or "=" char.
 34102 00002EAA 74F9                    	je	short get_cmt_token ; (we are allowing the other special
 34103 00002EAC 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9 	;  characters can used for comment id.
 34104 00002EAE 74F5                    	je	short get_cmt_token ;  character.)
 34105 00002EB0 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'='		; = is special in this case.
 34106 00002EB2 74F1                    	je	short get_cmt_token
 34107 00002EB4 3C0D                    	cmp	al,cr
 34108 00002EB6 7426                    	je	short get_cmt_end ; cannot accept the carriage return
 34109 00002EB8 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf
 34110 00002EBA 7422                    	je	short get_cmt_end
 34111                                  
 34112                                  	; 04/01/2023
 34113                                  	; ds = cs
 34114                                  	;mov	[cs:cmmt1],al	; store it
 34115                                  	;mov	byte [cs:cmmt],1 ; 1 char. so far.
 34116 00002EBC A2[CE03]                	mov	[cmmt1],al	; store it
 34117 00002EBF C606[CD03]01            	mov	byte [cmmt],1 ; 1 char. so far.
 34118 00002EC4 E8A600                  	call	get2
 34119 00002EC7 3C20                    	cmp	al,' ' ; 20h
 34120 00002EC9 7413                    	je	short get_cmt_end
 34121 00002ECB 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9
 34122 00002ECD 740F                    	je	short get_cmt_end
 34123 00002ECF 3C0D                    	cmp	al,cr  ; 0Dh
 34124 00002ED1 740B                    	je	short get_cmt_end
 34125 00002ED3 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf  ; 0Ah
 34126 00002ED5 740E                    	je	short end_commd_line_brdg
 34127                                  
 34128                                  	;mov	[cs:cmmt2],al
 34129                                  	;inc	byte [cs:cmmt]
 34130                                  	; 04/01/2023
 34131 00002ED7 A2[CF03]                	mov	[cmmt2],al
 34132 00002EDA FE06[CD03]              	inc	byte [cmmt]
 34133                                  
 34134                                  get_cmt_end:
 34135 00002EDE E88C00                  	call	get2
 34136 00002EE1 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf
 34137 00002EE3 75F9                    	jne	short get_cmt_end	; skip it.
 34138                                  end_commd_line_brdg: 
 34139 00002EE5 E9DAFE                  	jmp	end_commd_line		; else jmp to end_commd_line
 34140                                  
 34141                                  org_put_zero:				; make the filename in front of
 34142 00002EE8 26C60500                	mov	byte [es:di],0		;  the comment string to be an asciiz.
 34143 00002EEC 47                      	inc	di
 34144 00002EED E9D2FE                  	jmp	end_commd_line		;  (maybe null if device=/*)
 34145                                  
 34146                                  end_file_slash: 			; al = "/" option char.
 34147 00002EF0 26C60500                	mov	byte [es:di],0		; make a filename an asciiz
 34148 00002EF4 47                      	inc	di			; and
 34149 00002EF5 AA                      	stosb				; store "/" after that.
 34150 00002EF6 EB1A                    	jmp	short org5		; continue with the rest of the line
 34151                                  
 34152                                  end_copy_file:
 34153 00002EF8 26C645FF00              	mov	byte [es:di-1],0	; make it an asciiz and handle the next char.
 34154 00002EFD 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf
 34155 00002EFF 74E4                    	je	short end_commd_line_brdg
 34156 00002F01 EB0F                    	jmp	short org5
 34157                                  
 34158                                  org4:					; org4 skips all delimiters after the command name except for '/'
 34159 00002F03 E87D00                  	call	skip_comment
 34160 00002F06 74DD                    	jz	short end_commd_line_brdg
 34161                                  
 34162 00002F08 E86200                  	call	get2
 34163 00002F0B E8B300                  	call	org_delim		; skip delimiters except '/' (mrw 4/88)
 34164 00002F0E 74F3                    	jz	short org4
 34165 00002F10 EB08                    	jmp	short org51
 34166                                  
 34167                                  org5:					; rest of the line
 34168 00002F12 E86E00                  	call	skip_comment		; comment?
 34169 00002F15 74CE                    	jz	short end_commd_line_brdg
 34170 00002F17 E85300                  	call	get2			; not a comment.
 34171                                  
 34172                                  org51:
 34173 00002F1A AA                      	stosb				; copy the character
 34174 00002F1B 3C22                    	cmp	al,'"' 	; 22h		; a quote ?
 34175 00002F1D 743A                    	je	short at_quote
 34176 00002F1F 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '  ; 20h
 34177 00002F21 77EF                    	ja	short org5
 34178                                  					; M051 - Start
 34179                                  	; 04/01/2023
 34180                                  	; ds = cs
 34181 00002F23 803E[D003]55                    cmp	byte [cmd_indicator],CONFIG_DEVICEHIGH
 34182                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmd_indicator],CONFIG_DEVICEHIGH ; Q: is this devicehigh
 34183 00002F28 7514                    	jne	short not_dh		; N: 
 34184 00002F2A 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; Q: is this line feed
 34185 00002F2C 7416                    	je	short org_dhlf		; Y: stuff a blank before the lf
 34186 00002F2E 3C0D                    	cmp	al,cr			; Q: is this a cr
 34187 00002F30 75E0                    	jne	short org5		; N: 
 34188 00002F32 26C645FF20              	mov	byte [es:di-1],' '	; overwrite cr with blank
 34189 00002F37 AA                      	stosb				; put cr after blank
 34190 00002F38 FE06[0B2C]              	inc	byte [insert_blank]
 34191                                  	;inc	byte [cs:insert_blank]	; indicate that blank has been 
 34192                                  					; inserted
 34193 00002F3C EBD4                    	jmp	short org5
 34194                                  not_dh:					; M051 - End
 34195                                  
 34196 00002F3E 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; line feed?
 34197 00002F40 740F                    	je	short org1_brdg		; handles the next command line.
 34198 00002F42 EBCE                    	jmp	short org5		; handles next char in this line.
 34199                                  
 34200                                  org_dhlf:				; M051 - Start
 34201                                  	; 04/01/2023
 34202                                  	; ds = cs
 34203 00002F44 803E[0B2C]01            	cmp	byte [insert_blank],1
 34204                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:insert_blank],1 ; Q:has a blank already been inserted
 34205 00002F49 7406                    	je	short org1_brdg		; Y:
 34206 00002F4B 26C645FF20              	mov	byte [es:di-1],' '	; overwrite lf with blank
 34207 00002F50 AA                      	stosb				; put lf after blank
 34208                                  					; M051 - End
 34209                                  org1_brdg:
 34210 00002F51 C606[0B2C]00            	mov	byte [insert_blank],0 
 34211                                  	;mov	byte [cs:insert_blank],0 ; M051: clear blank indicator for 
 34212                                  					; M051: devicehigh
 34213 00002F56 E982FE                  	jmp	org1
 34214                                  
 34215                                  at_quote:
 34216 00002F59 803E[CC03]00            	cmp	byte [com_level],0
 34217                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:com_level],0
 34218 00002F5E 7407                    	je	short up_level

 34220 00002F60 C606[CC03]00            	mov	byte [com_level],0
 34221 00002F65 EBAB                    	jmp	short org5
 34222                                  
 34223                                  up_level:
 34224                                  	;inc	byte [cs:com_level]	; set it.
 34225 00002F67 FE06[CC03]              	inc	byte [com_level]
 34226 00002F6B EBA5                    	jmp	short org5

 34228                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34229                                  ;
 34230                                  ; procedure : get2
 34231                                  ;
 34232                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34233                                  
 34234                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 34235                                  	; (SYSINIT:33FAh)
 34236                                  	; 04/01/2023
 34237                                  get2:
 34238 00002F6D E304                    	jcxz	noget
 34239                                  	;
 34240                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 34241                                  	;;lods	byte ptr es:[si]
 34242                                  	; 12/12/2022
 34243 00002F6F 26                      	es	
 34244 00002F70 AC                      	lodsb
 34245                                  	;mov	al, [es:si]
 34246                                  	;inc	si
 34247                                  	;
 34248 00002F71 49                      	dec	cx
 34249 00002F72 C3                      	retn
 34250                                  noget:
 34251 00002F73 59                      	pop	cx
 34252                                  	; 04/01/2023
 34253                                  	; ds = cs
 34254                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di ; 13/05/2019
 34255                                  	;mov	[cs:org_count],di
 34256 00002F74 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di
 34257 00002F78 893E[D403]              	mov	[org_count],di
 34258 00002F7C 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 34259                                  	;mov	[cs:chrptr],si
 34260 00002F7E 8936[D603]              	mov	[chrptr],si
 34261                                  
 34262                                  ; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 34263                                  ;;ifndef MULTI_CONFIG
 34264                                  ;;	retn
 34265                                  ;;else
 34266                                  ;
 34267                                  ;;   This was the rather kludgy way out of procedure "organize", but instead
 34268                                  ;;   of returning to doconf, we now want to check config.sys BEGIN/END blocks
 34269                                  ;;   and the new boot menu stuff...
 34270                                  ;
 34271                                  ;	mov     cx,di
 34272                                  ;	jmp     menu_check
 34273                                  ;;endif
 34274                                  
 34275                                  	; 02/11/2022
 34276 00002F82 C3                      	retn

 34278                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34279                                  ;
 34280                                  ; procedure : skip_comment
 34281                                  ;
 34282                                  ;skip the commented string until lf, if current es:si-> a comment string.
 34283                                  ;in) es:si-> string
 34284                                  ;	 cx -> length.
 34285                                  ;out) zero flag not set if not found a comment string.
 34286                                  ;	  zero flag set if found a comment string and skipped it. al will contain
 34287                                  ;	  the line feed character at this moment when return.
 34288                                  ;	  ax register destroyed.
 34289                                  ;	  if found, si, cx register adjusted accordingly.
 34290                                  ;
 34291                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34292                                  
 34293                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34294                                  
 34295                                  skip_comment:
 34296 00002F83 E3EE                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of the organize routine.
 34297                                  
 34298                                  	; 04/01/2023
 34299                                  	; ds = cs	
 34300                                  
 34301 00002F85 803E[CC03]00            	cmp	byte [com_level],0
 34302                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:com_level],0 ; only check it if parameter level is 0.
 34303 00002F8A 752C                    	jne	short no_commt	 ; (not inside quotations)
 34304                                  
 34305 00002F8C 803E[CD03]01            	cmp	byte [cmmt],1
 34306                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],1
 34307 00002F91 7225                    	jb	short no_commt
 34308                                  
 34309 00002F93 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 34310                                  	
 34311 00002F96 3806[CE03]              	cmp	[cmmt1],al
 34312                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt1],al
 34313 00002F9A 751C                    	jne	short no_commt
 34314                                  
 34315 00002F9C 803E[CD03]02            	cmp	byte [cmmt],2
 34316                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],2
 34317 00002FA1 750A                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 34318                                  
 34319 00002FA3 268A4401                	mov	al,[es:si+1]
 34320                                  	
 34321 00002FA7 3806[CF03]              	cmp	[cmmt2],al
 34322                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt2],al
 34323 00002FAB 750B                    	jne	short no_commt
 34324                                  skip_cmmt:
 34325 00002FAD E3C4                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of organize routine.
 34326 00002FAF 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 34327 00002FB2 46                      	inc	si
 34328 00002FB3 49                      	dec	cx
 34329 00002FB4 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf		; line feed?
 34330 00002FB6 75F5                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 34331                                  no_commt:
 34332 00002FB8 C3                      	retn
 34333                                  
 34334                                  ; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 34335                                  %if 0
 34336                                  
 34337                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 34338                                  
 34339                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34340                                  ;
 34341                                  ;   kbd_read: wait for keystroke
 34342                                  ;
 34343                                  ;   INPUT
 34344                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 34345                                  ;
 34346                                  ;   OUTPUT
 34347                                  ;       Carry SET to clean boot, CLEAR otherwise
 34348                                  ;
 34349                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 34350                                  ;       All
 34351                                  ;
 34352                                  ;   HISTORY
 34353                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 34354                                  ;
 34355                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34356                                  
 34357                                  kbd_read:
 34358                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],2
 34359                                          jnz     short kbd_nodelay
 34360                                  
 34361                                          push    ds              ; the bios timer tick count is incremented
 34362                                          sub     ax,ax           ; 18.2 times per second;
 34363                                          mov     ds,ax           ; watch the timer tick count for 37 transitions
 34364                                  	;mov	dx,[046Ch]	; get initial value
 34365                                  kbd_loop:
 34366                                          mov     ah,1            ;
 34367                                          int     16h             ; peek the keyboard
 34368                                          jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; something's there, get out
 34369                                          mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 34370                                          int     16h             ;
 34371                                          test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 34372                                          jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; yes
 34373                                          mov     ax,[046Ch]	;
 34374                                  	;sub	ax,dx           ; get difference
 34375                                  	; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34376                                  	sub	ax,[cs:_timer_lw_] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:42E5h        
 34377                                  
 34378                                  	cmp     al,37           ; reached limit?
 34379                                          jb	short kbd_loop	; not yet
 34380                                  kbd_loopdone:
 34381                                          pop     ds              ; delay complete!
 34382                                  kbd_nodelay:
 34383                                          sub     bx,bx           ; assume clean boot
 34384                                          mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 34385                                          int     16h             ;
 34386                                          test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 34387                                          jz      short kbd_notshift ; no
 34388                                          inc     bx              ; yes
 34389                                          inc     bx
 34390                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4301h
 34391                                  	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4
 34392                                  kbd_notshift:                   ;
 34393                                          mov     ah,1            ; peek the keyboard
 34394                                          int     16h             ;
 34395                                          jz	short kbd_test	; no key present
 34396                                          or      al,al           ; is it a function key?
 34397                                          jnz	short kbd_test	; no
 34398                                  
 34399                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:430Bh
 34400                                          cmp     ah,62h          ; CTRL F5
 34401                                          je	short kbd_cfg_bypass
 34402                                  	
 34403                                          cmp     ah,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 34404                                          jne	short kbd_notf5	; no
 34405                                  kbd_cfg_bypass:
 34406                                          mov     dx,_$CleanMsg
 34407                                          call    print
 34408                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:431Bh
 34409                                  	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4           ;
 34410                                          jmp     short kbd_eat   ; yes, clean boot selected
 34411                                  kbd_notf5:
 34412                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4322h
 34413                                          cmp     ah,65h          ; CTRL F8
 34414                                          je	short kbd_cfg_confirm
 34415                                  
 34416                                          cmp     ah,42h          ; F8 function key?
 34417                                          jne	short kbd_exit	; no
 34418                                  kbd_cfg_confirm:
 34419                                          mov     dx,_$InterMsg
 34420                                          call    print           ;
 34421                                          mov     bl,1            ; yes, interactive-boot option enabled
 34422                                          mov     [bQueryOpt],bl  ; change default setting
 34423                                  kbd_eat:                        ;
 34424                                          mov     ah,0            ;
 34425                                          int     16h             ; eat the key we assumed was a signal
 34426                                          mov	byte [secElapsed],-1
 34427                                          or      bx,bx           ;
 34428                                          jz	short kbd_clean	;
 34429                                  kbd_test:                       ;
 34430                                          cmp     bl,2            ;
 34431                                          jb	short kbd_exit	;
 34432                                  kbd_clean:                      ;
 34433                                          call    disable_autoexec; yes, tell COMMAND to skip autoexec.bat
 34434                                          stc                     ; set carry to indicate abort
 34435                                          retn			;
 34436                                  kbd_exit:                       ;
 34437                                          clc                     ; clear carry to indicate success
 34438                                          retn			;
 34439                                  
 34440                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34441                                  ;
 34442                                  ;   set_numlock: set numlock LED
 34443                                  ;
 34444                                  ;   INPUT
 34445                                  ;       ES:SI -> numlock setting (ie, "ON" or "OFF")
 34446                                  ;
 34447                                  ;   OUTPUT
 34448                                  ;       None
 34449                                  ;
 34450                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 34451                                  ;       None
 34452                                  ;
 34453                                  ;   HISTORY
 34454                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 34455                                  ;
 34456                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34457                                  
 34458                                  set_numlock:
 34459                                          push    ax
 34460                                          push    ds
 34461                                          sub     ax,ax
 34462                                          mov     ds,ax
 34463                                          mov     ax,[es:si]      ; get 1st 2 bytes of value (ON or OF)
 34464                                          cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff+2]	; should we turn it off?
 34465                                          jne	short not_off	; no
 34466                                          and     byte [0417h],~20h ; 0DFh
 34467                                          jmp     short set_done
 34468                                  not_off:
 34469                                          cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff]	; should we turn it on?
 34470                                          stc
 34471                                          jne	short set_done	; no
 34472                                          or      byte [0417h],20h
 34473                                  set_done:
 34474                                          pop     ds
 34475                                          pop     ax
 34476                                          retn
 34477                                  
 34478                                  ; 16/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34479                                  
 34480                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34481                                  ;
 34482                                  ;   menu_check:  check for presence of menu (and other) configuration blocks
 34483                                  ;
 34484                                  ;   INPUT
 34485                                  ;       CX == "organized" config.sys memory image length
 34486                                  ;    ES:SI -> "organized" config.sys memory image
 34487                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 34488                                  ;
 34489                                  ;   OUTPUT
 34490                                  ;       Same as above;  the idea is that menu_check simply transforms
 34491                                  ;       a block-structured config.sys image into a conventional image,
 34492                                  ;       based on the user's block selection and any other boot-time options
 34493                                  ;       the user may have employed...
 34494                                  ;
 34495                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 34496                                  ;       All
 34497                                  ;
 34498                                  ;   NOTES
 34499                                  ;       [count] and [org_count] are set to the new config.sys image length
 34500                                  ;
 34501                                  ;   HISTORY
 34502                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 34503                                  ;
 34504                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34505                                  
 34506                                  menu_check:
 34507                                  
 34508                                  ;   Search for SWITCHES, determine if /N or /F are present;  if so, then
 34509                                  ;   disable clean/interactive boot options
 34510                                  
 34511                                          push    cx              ;
 34512                                          push    si              ;
 34513                                          sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 34514                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 34515                                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 34516                                          jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 34517                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ;
 34518                                          jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 34519                                          inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 34520                                          jmp     short swchk_nextline
 34521                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 34522                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 34523                                          jne	short swchk_next2 ;
 34524                                          or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 34525                                          jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 34526                                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 34527                                          mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 34528                                          jmp     short swchk_nextline
 34529                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 34530                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 34531                                          jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 34532                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 34533                                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 34534                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 34535                                          cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 34536                                          je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 34537                                          cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 34538                                          jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 34539                                          call    get_char        ;
 34540                                          and     al,~20h ; 0DFh	; convert to upper case
 34541                                          cmp     al,[swit_n+1]
 34542                                          jne	short swchk_scan2 ; no
 34543                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 34544                                          jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 34545                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;
 34546                                          cmp     al,[swit_f+1]
 34547                                          jne	short swchk_scan1 ; no
 34548                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],2
 34549                                          jmp     short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 34550                                  swchk_nextline:                 ;
 34551                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 34552                                          jmp     short swchk_loop ;
 34553                                  swchk_end:                      ;
 34554                                          pop     si              ;
 34555                                          pop     cx              ;
 34556                                  
 34557                                  ;   Do the keyboard tests for clean/interactive boot now, but only if
 34558                                  ;   the DisableUI flag is still clear
 34559                                  
 34560                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 34561                                          jnz	short menu_search
 34562                                  ;
 34563                                  ;   Wait for 2 seconds first, UNLESS the /F bit was set in bDisableUI, or
 34564                                  ;   there is anything at all in the keyboard buffer
 34565                                  ;
 34566                                          call    kbd_read
 34567                                          jnc	short menu_search
 34568                                          jmp	menu_abort
 34569                                  
 34570                                  ;   Search for MENU block;  it is allowed to be anywhere in config.sys
 34571                                  
 34572                                  menu_search:
 34573                                          sub     bx,bx           ; if no MENU, default to zero for no_selection
 34574                                          mov     di,szMenu	;
 34575                                          call    find_block      ; find the MENU block
 34576                                          jnc	short menu_found ;
 34577                                          mov     byte [szBoot],0
 34578                                          jmp	no_selection ; not found
 34579                                  
 34580                                  ;   Process the requested menu color(s)
 34581                                  
 34582                                  menu_color:
 34583                                          push    cx              ;
 34584                                          push    dx              ;
 34585                                          mov     dx,0007h        ; default color setting
 34586                                          call    get_number	; get first number
 34587                                          and     bl,0Fh		; first # is foreground color (for low nibble)
 34588                                          mov     ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 34589                                          and     dl,0F0h         ;
 34590                                          or      dl,bl           ;
 34591                                          call    delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 34592                                          jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 34593                                          call    get_number	; get next number
 34594                                          and     bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 34595                                          mov     dh,bl           ; save it in DH
 34596                                          and     dl,0Fh		;
 34597                                          mov     cl,4            ;
 34598                                          shl     bl,cl           ;
 34599                                          or      dl,bl           ;
 34600                                  check_color:                    ;
 34601                                          cmp     ch,dh           ; are foreground/background the same?
 34602                                          jne	short set_color	; no
 34603                                          xor     dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 34604                                  set_color:
 34605                                          mov     [bMenuColor],dl ;
 34606                                          pop     dx              ;
 34607                                          pop     cx              ;
 34608                                          jmp	menu_nextitem
 34609                                  
 34610                                  ;   Back to our regularly scheduled program (the COLOR and other goop
 34611                                  ;   above is there simply to alleviate short jump problems)
 34612                                  
 34613                                  menu_found:
 34614                                          mov     byte [bDefBlock],1
 34615                                          mov     word [offDefBlock],0
 34616                                          mov     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 34617                                          and     byte [bQueryOpt],~2 ; 0FDh
 34618                                  
 34619                                          call    skip_opt_line   ; skip to next line
 34620                                          sub     dx,dx           ; initialize total block count (0 => none yet)
 34621                                  
 34622                                  ;   Process the menu block now
 34623                                  
 34624                                  menu_process:
 34625                                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 34626                                          jc	short to_menu_getdefault ; could happen if menu block at end (rare)
 34627                                          and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 34628                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; BEGIN implies END
 34629                                          je	short to_menu_getdefault
 34630                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_SUBMENU
 34631                                          je	short menu_item	; go process sub-menu
 34632                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUITEM
 34633                                          je	short menu_item	; go process menu item
 34634                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUDEFAULT
 34635                                          je	short menu_default ; go process menu default
 34636                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUCOLOR
 34637                                          je	short menu_color ; go process menu color
 34638                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 34639                                          je	short menu_numlock ;
 34640                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_REM   ; allow remarks in menu block
 34641                                          je	short menu_nextitem ;
 34642                                          call    any_delim       ; allow blank lines and such
 34643                                          je	short menu_nextitem ;
 34644                                          stc                     ;
 34645                                          call    print_error     ; non-MENU command!
 34646                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 34647                                  menu_numlock:
 34648                                          call    set_numlock
 34649                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 34650                                  to_menu_getdefault:
 34651                                          jmp     short menu_getdefault
 34652                                  
 34653                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 34654                                  
 34655                                  menu_default:
 34656                                          mov     [offDefBlock],si; save address of default block name
 34657                                          cmp     byte [secElapsed],0
 34658                                          jne	short timeout_skip ; secElapsed is only zero for the FIRST menu,
 34659                                          call    skip_token      ; and for subsequent menus IF nothing was typed;
 34660                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; secElapsed becomes -1 forever as soon as
 34661                                          call    skip_delim      ; something is typed
 34662                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ;
 34663                                          mov     si,bx           ;
 34664                                          call    get_number      ; get number (of seconds for timeout)
 34665                                          cmp     bl,90           ; limit it to a reasonable number
 34666                                          jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 34667                                          mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)
 34668                                  timeout_ok:                     ;
 34669                                          mov     [secTimeOut],bl ;
 34670                                  timeout_skip:
 34671                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 34672                                  
 34673                                  ;   Verify that this is a valid menu item by searching for the named block
 34674                                  
 34675                                  menu_item:
 34676                                          cmp     dl,MAX_MULTI_CONFIG ; have we reached the max # of items yet?
 34677                                          jae	short menu_nextitem ;
 34678                                          mov     di,si           ; DS:DI -> block name to search for
 34679                                          call    srch_block      ;
 34680                                          je	short menu_itemfound ;
 34681                                          stc                     ;
 34682                                          call    print_error     ; print error and pause
 34683                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem ; if not found, ignore this menu item
 34684                                  
 34685                                  ;   srch_block, having succeeded, returns DI -> past the token that it
 34686                                  ;   just matched, which in this case should be a descriptive string; ES:SI
 34687                                  ;   and CX are unmodified
 34688                                  
 34689                                  menu_itemfound:
 34690                                          inc     dx              ; otherwise, increment total block count
 34691                                          mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets
 34692                                          mov	[abBlockType+bx],al
 34693                                          add     bx,bx           ; of recorded block names and descriptions
 34694                                  
 34695                                  ;   There should be a description immediately following the block name on
 34696                                  ;   MENUITEM line; failing that, we'll just use the block name as the
 34697                                  ;   description...
 34698                                  
 34699                                          mov     [aoffBlockName+bx],si
 34700                                          mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],si
 34701                                          mov     di,bx           ; skip_delim modifies BX, so stash it in DI
 34702                                          call    skip_token      ;
 34703                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 34704                                          call    skip_delim      ;
 34705                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 34706                                          xchg    bx,di           ;
 34707                                          mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],di
 34708                                  
 34709                                  menu_nextitem:
 34710                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 34711                                          jmp     menu_process    ; go back for more lines
 34712                                  
 34713                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 34714                                  
 34715                                  menu_getdefault:
 34716                                          or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 34717                                          jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 34718                                          sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 34719                                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 34720                                  menu_valid:
 34721                                          sub     bx,bx           ;
 34722                                          mov     [bMaxBlock],dl  ; first, record how many blocks we found
 34723                                          mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 34724                                          or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 34725                                          jz	short menu_nodefault ; no
 34726                                          inc     bx              ; yes, walk name table, looking for default
 34727                                  menu_chkdefault:
 34728                                          push    bx              ;
 34729                                          add     bx,bx           ;
 34730                                          mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 34731                                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 34732                                          push    ds              ;
 34733                                          push    es              ;
 34734                                          pop     ds              ;
 34735                                          call    comp_names      ; is this block the same as the default?
 34736                                          pop     ds              ;
 34737                                          pop     bx              ;
 34738                                          je	short menu_setdefault ; yes
 34739                                          inc     bx              ;
 34740                                          cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done searching?
 34741                                          jbe	short menu_chkdefault ; not yet
 34742                                  menu_nodefault:
 34743                                          mov     bl,1            ; if no default, force default to #1
 34744                                  menu_setdefault:
 34745                                          mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 34746                                  
 34747                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 34748                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 34749                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 34750                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 34751                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 34752                                  ;   with no timeout)
 34753                                  
 34754                                          cmp     byte [secTimeOut],0 ; is timeout zero? (ie, assume default)
 34755                                          jne	short menu_display ; no
 34756                                          test    byte [bQueryOpt],1 ; yes, but was INTERACTIVE requested?
 34757                                          jnz	short menu_display ; yes, so *don't* assume default after all
 34758                                          jmp     not_topmenu	;
 34759                                  
 34760                                  ;   Reset the mode, so that we know screen is clean and cursor is home
 34761                                  
 34762                                  menu_display:
 34763                                          mov     ah,0Fh          ; get current video mode
 34764                                          int     10h             ;
 34765                                          mov     ah,00h          ; just re-select that mode
 34766                                          int     10h             ;
 34767                                          push    es              ;
 34768                                          mov     ax,40h          ; reach down into the ROM BIOS data area
 34769                                          mov     es,ax           ; and save the current (default) video page
 34770                                          mov     ax,[es:004Eh]   ; start address and page #, in case the
 34771                                          mov     [wCRTStart],ax  ; undocumented QUIET option was enabled
 34772                                          mov     al,[es:0062h]   ;
 34773                                          mov     [bCRTPage],al   ;
 34774                                          mov     ax,[bMenuPage]	; select new page for menu
 34775                                          int     10h             ;
 34776                                          mov     ax,0600h        ; clear entire screen
 34777                                          mov     bh,[bMenuColor] ; using this color
 34778                                          sub     cx,cx           ; upper left row/col
 34779                                          ;mov	dl,[es:CRT_Cols] 
 34780                                          mov	dl,[es:4Ah]
 34781                                  	dec     dl              ;
 34782                                          ;mov	dh,[es:CRT_Rows];
 34783                                          mov	dh,[es:84h]
 34784                                  	or      dh,dh           ; # of rows valid?
 34785                                          jnz	short menu_clear ; hopefully
 34786                                          mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; no, use a default
 34787                                  menu_clear:
 34788                                          int     10h             ; clear the screen using the req. attribute
 34789                                          pop     es              ;
 34790                                          mov     [bLastRow],dh   ; save DH
 34791                                          mov     dx,_$MenuHeader
 34792                                          call    print           ; cursor now on row 3 (numbered from 0)
 34793                                  
 34794                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 34795                                          jnz     short menu_nostatus
 34796                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 34797                                          mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; restore DH
 34798                                          mov     dl,0            ; print the status line on row DH, col 0,
 34799                                          mov     ah,02h          ; now that we can trash the cursor position
 34800                                          int     10h             ;
 34801                                          mov     dx,_$StatusLine
 34802                                          call    print           ;
 34803                                          mov     ah,3            ; get cursor position
 34804                                          int     10h             ;
 34805                                          sub     dl,2            ;
 34806                                          mov     [bLastCol],dl   ; save column where status char will go
 34807                                  
 34808                                  menu_nostatus:
 34809                                          mov     bx,1            ; now prepare to display all the menu items
 34810                                  menu_disploop:
 34811                                          call    print_item	; print item #BL
 34812                                          inc     bx              ; why "inc bx"?  because it's a 1-byte opcode
 34813                                          cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done?
 34814                                          jbe	short menu_disploop ; not yet
 34815                                  
 34816                                  ;   Set cursor position to just below the menu items
 34817                                  
 34818                                          mov     dl,0            ; select column
 34819                                          mov     dh,bl           ;
 34820                                          add     dh,4            ; select row below menu
 34821                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 34822                                          mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position beneath the block list
 34823                                          int     10h             ;
 34824                                  
 34825                                          mov     dx,_$MenuPrmpt
 34826                                          call    print           ;
 34827                                          call    select_item     ; make a selection, return # in BX
 34828                                          mov     dx,crlfm	
 34829                                          call    print           ;
 34830                                          push    word [bDisableUI]
 34831                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 34832                                          call    show_status     ; clear the status line now
 34833                                          pop     word [bDisableUI]
 34834                                  
 34835                                  ;   Now begins the "re-organization" process...
 34836                                  
 34837                                  menu_autoselect:
 34838                                          cmp     bx,-1           ; clean boot requested?
 34839                                          jne	short normal_boot ; no
 34840                                          call    disable_autoexec; basically, add a /D to the command.com line
 34841                                  menu_abort:
 34842                                          sub     cx,cx           ; then immediately exit with 0 config.sys image
 34843                                          jmp	menu_exit	;
 34844                                  
 34845                                  normal_boot:
 34846                                          cmp     bx,-2           ; back to top-level menu?
 34847                                          jne	short not_topmenu ; no
 34848                                          mov     cx,[count]      ; yes, start all over
 34849                                          sub     si,si           ;
 34850                                          jmp     menu_search
 34851                                  
 34852                                  not_topmenu:
 34853                                          cmp     byte [abBlockType+bx],CONFIG_SUBMENU
 34854                                          jne	short not_submenu
 34855                                          add     bx,bx           ;
 34856                                          mov     di,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 34857                                          call    srch_block      ; THIS CANNOT FAIL!
 34858                                          mov     si,di           ;
 34859                                          mov     cx,bx           ; ES:SI and CX are ready for another round
 34860                                          jmp     menu_found
 34861                                  
 34862                                  not_submenu:
 34863                                          add     bx,bx           ; get BX -> name of selected block
 34864                                          mov     bx,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 34865                                  
 34866                                  ;   BX should now either be ZERO (meaning no block has been selected) or
 34867                                  ;   the offset relative to ES of the block name to be processed (along with
 34868                                  ;   all the "common" lines of course)
 34869                                  
 34870                                  no_selection:
 34871                                          mov     [offDefBlock],bx; save selection
 34872                                          mov     cx,[count]      ; reset ES:SI and CX for reprocessing
 34873                                          sub     si,si           ;
 34874                                          push    ds              ;
 34875                                          mov     ds,[config_wrkseg]; this is where we'll store new config.sys image
 34876                                          sub     di,di           ;
 34877                                  
 34878                                  ;   ES:SI-> config.sys, DS:DI -> new config.sys workspace
 34879                                  ;
 34880                                  ;   Work our way through the config.sys image again, this time copying
 34881                                  ;   all lines that are (A) "common" lines outside any block or (B) lines
 34882                                  ;   within the requested block.  Lines inside INCLUDEd blocks are transparently
 34883                                  ;   copied by copy_block in a recursive fashion;  the amount of recursion is
 34884                                  ;   limited by the fact INCLUDE statements are REMed by copy_block as they are
 34885                                  ;   processed and by the number of unique INCLUDE stmts in config.sys...
 34886                                  ;
 34887                                  ;   BUGBUG 20-Mar-1992 JeffPar: If we can figure out the lower bound of the
 34888                                  ;   stack we're running on, then we should check it inside copy_block
 34889                                  
 34890                                  copyblock_loop:
 34891                                          push    bx              ; save selected block name
 34892                                          call    copy_block      ; process (named or common) block
 34893                                          pop     bx              ;
 34894                                          jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 34895                                  
 34896                                  ;   copy_block can only return for two reasons:  it hit eof or a new block
 34897                                  
 34898                                  copyblock_begin:
 34899                                          push    ax              ;
 34900                                          push    cx              ;
 34901                                          push    si              ;
 34902                                          push    di              ; always do "common" blocks
 34903                                          mov     di,szCommon
 34904                                          push    ds              ;
 34905                                          push    cs              ;
 34906                                          pop     ds              ;
 34907                                          call    comp_names      ;
 34908                                          pop     ds              ;
 34909                                          pop     di              ;
 34910                                          pop     si              ;
 34911                                          pop     cx              ;
 34912                                          pop     ax              ;
 34913                                          je	short copyblock_check
 34914                                          or      bx,bx           ; is there a block name to check?
 34915                                          jz	short copyblock_skip ; no
 34916                                          push    di              ;
 34917                                          mov     di,bx           ; check block against given block name
 34918                                          push    ds              ;
 34919                                          push    es              ;
 34920                                          pop     ds              ;
 34921                                          call    comp_names      ; is this the block we really want to do?
 34922                                          pop     ds              ;
 34923                                          pop     di              ;
 34924                                  copyblock_check:
 34925                                          jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 34926                                          jne	short copyblock_skip  ;
 34927                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 34928                                          jmp	short copyblock_loop 
 34929                                  
 34930                                  copyblock_skip:                 ;
 34931                                          call    skip_opt_line   ; this ain't the block we wanted, so skip it
 34932                                          call    get_char        ;
 34933                                          jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 34934                                          and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 34935                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ;
 34936                                          je	short copyblock_begin
 34937                                          jmp     short copyblock_skip ; anything else is just skipped
 34938                                  ;
 34939                                  ;   To create as little risk to the rest of SysInit as little as possible,
 34940                                  ;   and to free the workspace at "config_wrkseg" for creating an environment,
 34941                                  ;   copy the new config.sys image to "confbot"
 34942                                  ;
 34943                                  move_config:
 34944                                          mov     cx,di           ; now copy workspace at DS:DI to "confbot"
 34945                                          push    cx              ;
 34946                                  ;
 34947                                  ;   But first, copy the CONFIG=<configuration><0> string to the workspace,
 34948                                  ;   since the configuration name only currently exists in the "confbot" area
 34949                                  ;
 34950                                   	;mov	cx,7
 34951                                  	mov     cx,szMenu-szBoot-1
 34952                                          mov     si,szBoot	; first copy the CONFIG= part
 34953                                          inc     di              ; skip a byte, in case absolutely nothing
 34954                                                                  ; was copied to the workspace, because we always
 34955                                                                  ; zero the first byte of the workspace (below)
 34956                                  copy_boot: 
 34957                                  	;lods    byte ptr cs:[si];
 34958                                          cs
 34959                                  	lodsb
 34960                                  	mov     [di],al         ;
 34961                                          inc     di              ;
 34962                                          loop    copy_boot       ;
 34963                                  
 34964                                          push    es              ; then copy the configuration name
 34965                                          mov     cx,128-7        ; put an upper limit on the name, to be safe
 34966                                          mov     si,[cs:offDefBlock]; ES:SI -> default block name
